description.hltext_display: Abren Santa Elena y darán vía en Palmas
description.content:
Este viernes 24 de diciembre en horas de la tarde, se habilitará paso provisional por el carril de descenso en el kilómetro 7 de la vía Las Palmas, informó el gerente de Concesiones de la Gobernación de Antioquia, Rodrigo Caicedo.
En el kilómetro siete se habilita el paso en los dos sentidos, luego de una ardua labor, pensando en las necesidades de los usuarios, lugareños y comerciantes, en la que se logró canalizar las aguas en la zona y colocar una serie de filtros y drenes.
El sitio del paso provisional, que funcionará las 24 horas con restricción para vehículos pesados, contará con vigilancia permanente y se aplicarán todos los protocolos de seguridad existentes para este tipo de situaciones.
Abierta Santa Elena
El gerente de Concesiones también anunció que desde ayer hay paso por la vía Santa Elena, la cual es objeto de obras en el kilómetro 10+700, pero que permiten ya comenzar a usarla con una serie de cuidados.
La apertura de la vía, que se retrasó debido a un derrumbe que cayó 500 metros más arriba del sitio de las obras, el cual ya fue removido, operará las 24 horas para vehículos particulares y de transporte público. En cuanto los vehículos de carga, sólo podrán circular hasta de 4 toneladas.

description.hltext_display: Greek bond downgrade warning adds pressure on government as it votes on budget
description.content:
ATHENS, Greece - Greece's parliament is due to vote on the 2011 budget Wednesday, a day after the Fitch ratings agency warned of a possible downgrade of Greek bonds, adding pressure on the government.
Fitch said on Tuesday that the action "indicates that there is a heightened probability that Greece's sovereign ratings will be downgraded" from its current BBB-minus status after a review is completed next month.
It follows similar warnings from ratings agencies Moody's and Standard and Poor's earlier in December.
A series of ratings downgrades threw Greece into financial turmoil last year — and sparked a crisis for the euro — after the country's new Socialist government revealed misreporting of deficit figures that raised concern over Athens' ability to repay its debts.
The country came to the brink of default last May before receiving a bailout loan package worth euro110 billion ($145 billion) over three years from European Union countries and the International Monetary Fund.
The government is facing increasing hostility over austerity measures from unions and opposition parties
The latest in a wave of strikes this month will also see all public transport halted in greater Athens on Wednesday, but will not affect flights and ferry services.
Even the Greek Orthodox Church and skeptics within the Socialist Party have publicly criticized the reforms as unfairly hurting the poor.
Party veteran Vasso Papandreou, a former EU Employment Commissioner, said the successive cuts by the government were "strangling society," but said she would vote with the government.
"Does this mean we are talking about a credible budget that will be executed with precision and will get us out of the impasse?" she told parliament. "My answer is no."
The Socialists have 156 seats in the 300-member parliament.
___
Fitch Ratings: http://www.fitchratings.com/

description.hltext_display: Yemekten hemen sonra diş fırçalamak zararlı
description.content:
161 okunma 0 yorum Genel Yazdır Dişlerinize çok önem veriyorsunuz ve çürüklerin önüne geçmek için her yemek sonrası vakit kaybetmeden fırçalıyorsunuz. Ama bu diş yüzeyinden bir miktar maddenin kalkmasına sebep olarak diş sağlığınızı olumsuz etkiler.
Bu durum ilk bakışta diş sağlığını korumak iin mkemmel bir yntem olarak grnebilir; ancak yemek sonrası hemen dişlerin fıralanması diş yzeyinden bir miktar maddenin kalkmasına sebep olarak diş sağlığınızı olumsuz etkiler. Memorial Suadiye Tıp Merkezi Ağız, Diş ve ene Hastalıkları Blmnden Dt. Aslı Tapan, diş sağlığına zarar veren gıdalar ve fıralama yntemleri hakkında bilgi verdi. Yemek sonrası fıralama diş yzeyinden bir miktar madde kaldırır
Ağız diş sağlığının korunmasının temelinde temizlik ve bakım yatmaktadır. Yemeklerden ve asitli ieceklerden hemen sonra dişleri fıralamaktan kaınılmalıdır. nk bu tr gıdalardan sonra yaklaşık bir saat diş minesi asit saldırısı altında olup minenin yumuşadığı ve hemen yapılan fıralamanın diş yzeyinden bir miktar madde kaldırdığı bilinmektedir. İngilterede yapılan bir araştırma neticesinde 5 yaşındaki ocukların %53nde diş erozyonu saptanmıştır. Gazlı iecekler dışında meyve suları da dişlerde erozyon riskini artırmaktadır. Dişler aşındıka renk bozulmaları ve hassasiyet artar
Asitli gıda denince akla; narenciye, yeşil elma, turşu, şarap, enerji iecekleri ve şarap gelir. Ph ne kadar dşk ise rn o kadar asidiktir. Phın 5.5ten kk olması rk oluşturmaktadır. Alkaliler yksek pha sahiptir. Dşk phlı rnlerden bazıları sirke, kırmızı şarap, greyfurt, turşu vs.dir. Stn phı 6.9, cheddar peynirinin ise 5.9dur. Ayrıca kişilerde artan estetik beklentisi sebebiyle dişleri beyazlatmak iin aşındırıcı diş macunu ve diş parlatma tozları talebi diş sağlığını olumsuz ynde etkilemektedir. Dişin minesi aşındıka alttaki dentin tabakasının aığa ıkmasıyla dişin rengi daha sarı gzkmekte, sıcak ve soğuk hassasiyeti de buna eklenmektedir. İlerlemiş dnemde artan duyarlılık, oluşan atlaklar, giderek artan renk bozulmaları gzlenebilir. Ara ğnleri şekeriz gıdalardan sein ve yatmadan nce mutlaka dişlerinizi fıralayın Pek ok işlenmiş besinde şeker bulunur. Şeker ilavesizdir ibaresi her zaman o besinde şeker olmadığını gstermez. Ara ğnler şekersiz gıdalardan seilmelidir. Kurutulmuş meyvelerin şeker miktarı daha fazladır ve dişe yapışabilir. Ara ğnde meyve yenirse arkasından peynir gibi alkali bir besin yemelidir. Su ve st en iyi ieceklerdir. Meyve suları yemek sırasında iilebilir. Ara ğnde yalnız imesi istenirse de suyla seyreltilmesi nerilir. Gece rk riski artacağından yatmadan nce mutlaka zenle fıralanmalıdır. Erozyonun şiddeti; zaman, ph, asit tipi, ısı ve likit akış oranı gibi faktrlerle ilgilidir. Geleneksel ayın phı 4.8, bitki ayının 3.2dir. Dolayısıyla bitki ayları normal aya oranla daha erozivdir. rkten ve asit erozyonundan korumak iin neler yapmalıyız? ocuklarımızda st ve su gibi ieceklerin tketimini arttırma yoluna gidilmelidir. Yoğurt dşk phına rağmen erozyona yol amayabilir. nk iinde yksek miktarda kalsiyum ve fosfat vardır. Meyve sularına asidik ieceklere kalsiyum eklenerek erozyon nlenebilir. Ancak iyi maskelenmezse ağza tebeşirimsi bir tat gelir. Asitli ieceklerin iine florr eklenmesi ok tketimi halinde risk taşır. Daha konsantre bir iecek diş yzeyine daha ok yapışır ve ağızda daha uzun sre kalır. Gece tkrk akışı azaldığında asitler dişte daha ok erozyona yol aar. Bu nedenle gece mutlak suretle dişlerimizi fıralamalıyız. Uye Misafir Diğer sağlık haberleri Sosyal Ağlarda Paylaş Rasgele Bilgiler

description.hltext_display: Thieves steal skip from Greenfield, Flintshire
description.content:
THIEVES have stolen an entire skip filled with scrap metal.
They used a 32 tonne skip wagon to steal the blue scrap container, with the words "S Norton” written on the side, from Gibbs Engineering in Dock Road, Greenfield.
The theft happened on December 14 around 5.35pm. It was last spotted at 6pm that day at the top of the Well Hill in Greenfield.
Call police on 101.

description.hltext_display: Mau tempo: Caos nos aeroportos é inaceitável - Bruxelas
description.content:
| Imprimir A Comissão Europeia considerou hoje que o caos e a confusão nos aeroportos europeus é uma situação «inaceitável», que não se «deverá repetir» e ameaçou com a aprovação de nova legislação sobre mínimos aeroportuários.
«Estou extremamente preocupado com os nível de perturbações que a neve causou nas viagens na Europa. É inaceitável e não se deveria repetir», afirmou, em comunicado, o comissário europeu dos Transportes, Siim Kallas.
O comissário europeu disse que já agendou reuniões, «nos próximos dias», com representantes do setor aeroportuário europeu para exigir «explicações».
Diário Digital / Lusa

description.hltext_display: Govt battles onion prices, waives import duty
Ersan İlyasova'dan double double
description.content:
Amerikan Ulusal Basketbol Ligi'ne (NBA), dn akşam oynanan 6 mala devam edildi. Amway Center'da Orlando Magic'e konuk olan Dallas Maverics, sahadan 105-99 galip ayrıldı ve bu sonula son 17 mataki 16. galibiyetini aldı.
Maverics'te Caron Butler 20, Dirk Nowitzki 17 sayıyla oynarken, Jason Kidd, maı 13 sayı 12 asistle tamamladı. nceki gece Miami Heat'in 12 malık galibiyet serisine son veren Maverics, aynı başarılı performansı dn akşam da srdrd ve 2 sayılık atışlarda yzde 50, 3 sayılık atışlarda ise yzde 46'lık başarı oranı yakaladı.
Kadrosuna kattığı yeni isimlerle tekrar yapılanma srecine giren evsahibi ekipte ise Dwight Howard, attığı attığı 26 sayıyla hem takımının hem de sahanın en skorer ismi oldu. Howard, 23 de ribaund alarak ''double double'' yaptı. JJ Reddick 21 sayıyla oynarken, Hidayet Trkoğlu maı 9 sayı 8 asist 1 ribaunt ile tamamladı. Bir diğer mata Chicago Bulls ile Philadelphia 76ers karşı karşıya geldi. Maa Joakim Noah ve Taj Gibson'dan yoksun ıkan Bulls, evinde oynadığı maı 45 sayı farkla, 121-76 kazanmayı başardı. Bulls'da Carlos Boozer 16 sayı 11 ribaund, Derrick Rose ise 22 sayı 12 asist ile galibiyette byk rol oynadı. Takımın bir diğer skorer ismi, rakip potaya 22 sayı bırakan Luol Deng oldu. Bulls'un Trk basketbolcusu mer Aşık ise maı 8 sayı 6 ribaund ile tamamladı.
76ers'da Andre Iguodala 17 sayıyla oynadı. Chicago Bulls, bu sonula son 9 mata 8. galibiyetini almış oldu. Bir diğer Trk basketbolcu Ersan İlyasova'nın formasını giydiği Milwakuee Bucks ise dn gece Staples Center'da Los Angeles Lakers'a konuk oldu. İlyasova'nın olduka iyi bir performans sergilediği mata Bucks, rakibine 98-79 ile stnlk sağladı. Sahanın en skorer ismi, 22 sayıyla oynayan Bucks oyuncusu Earl Boykins oldu. Takım arkadaşı John Salmons, geceyi 20 sayıyla tamamlarken, Ersan İlyasova, 17 sayı 11 ribaund ile ''double double'' yaparak galibiyete byk bir katkı sağladı.
Los Angeles Lakers'da ise Kobe Bryant geceyi 21 sayıyla tamamladı. Gecenin diğer malarında şu sonular alındı: Charlotte Bobcats: 81 - Oklahoma City Thunder: 99
Memphis Grizzlies: 94 - New Jersey Nets: 101
Sacramento Kings: 109 - Golden State Warriors: 117
AA

description.hltext_display: En el Centro se pone orden
description.content:
Un escenario fundamental en la temporada decembrina es el Centro por la alta afluencia de compradores y las autoridades lo tienen como prioritario en cuanto al sistema de vigilancia y a la organización del espacio.
El subsecretario de Orden Ciudadano de la Secretaría de Gobierno, Juan de Dios Graciano, explicó que su personal está en guardia para garantizar que las compras se hagan con máxima tranquilidad y tratando de minimizar las aglomeraciones.
En esta tarea tiene a 300 hombres y mujeres dedicados a evitar la invasión del espacio público y a que no se presenten conflictos entre los mismos comerciantes formales e informales.
"Desde noviembre se empezó a organizar y a preparar la temporada, se tomaron unas medidas preventivas que en este momento nos permiten que haya una convivencia en el Centro", explicó.
Sus funcionarios, que trabajan de la mano con la Policía y aplican el mismo sistema de los cuadrantes y de la vigilancia cuadra a cuadra, también son un apoyo para los ciudadanos.
Incluso, un grupo de más de 50 trabaja en distintos eventos comunitarios navideños que se realizan en distintos puntos de Medellín, incluidos los barrios.
En los alumbrados, tanto en el corredor del río como en La Playa y demás sitios iluminados, su presencia garantiza que no se genere caos.
"A veces hay grupos ilegales que quieren, con sus intereses, interferir la labor de las personas que laboran honestamente y la gente no debe permitir eso", alertó.
La trilogía Espacio Público-Policía y ciudadanos es la clave para que la Navidad se viva con seguridad y en orden, afirmó el subsecretario.

description.hltext_display: Another white Christmas possible
description.author: Phil Anderson
description.content:
Get out those coats, scarves, gloves, boots and shovels forecasters are calling for the first winter storm of the season to dump 2 to 4 inches of snow on Topeka and the vicinity later this week.
And yes, with high temperatures in the lower 30s on Friday and mid-20s on Saturday, the snow that falls could stick on the ground long enough for another white Christmas in Topeka.
"That's what everybody wants to know, isn't it?" Kris Craven, a meteorologist with the National Weather Service office in Topeka, said Tuesday. "It does look like we're going to get something. Right now, it's a question of how far north or south the system is going to go."
If the capital city does have snow on the ground Saturday, it will mark the second year in a row for a white Christmas, though the amounts this year should be less than the record 4.1 inches that fell on Christmas Day 2009.
The weather service is calling for a 70 percent chance of a wintry mix on Thursday afternoon, with freezing rain and sleet changing over to snow by Thursday night and continuing into Friday. Light ice accumulations will be possible Thursday and Thursday night.
The chance for light snow will end Friday, but not before the Topeka vicinity gets an expected 2 to 4 inches of snow, according to the weather service.
Snowfall amounts could increase based on the development of the storm system. Locally, higher amounts are possible depending on the timing of the transition to snow.
The chance for snow is the result of a strong storm system that will emerge from the Rockies on Thursday, bringing the potential for widespread precipitation to much of the central and southern Plains, according to the weather service.
The storm system will move east of the region during the day on Friday.
The weather service said the timing of this round of winter weather will affect the northeast Kansas area during a period of heavy holiday travel. If the storm system comes together over the area, roadways will become slick with hazardous driving conditions as early as noon Thursday. Some blowing and drifting snow will be possible late Thursday night and Friday. The weather service advised those intending to be on the road for the Christmas holiday to plan their travel accordingly and allow extra time if road conditions deteriorate.
Before the snow falls, dry conditions and highs in the lower 30s should rule the day Wednesday.
Phil Anderson can be reached at (785) 295-1195 or phil.anderson@cjonline.com.

description.hltext_display: Kung Abdullah utskriven från sjukhus
description.content:
Saudiarabiens 86-årige kung Abdullah har skrivits ut från Presbyteriansjukhuset i New York, där han legat en månad i samband med ryggradskirurgi.
Kung åkte i tisdags kväll till "sitt New York-residens, för en tids konvalescens och fysioterapi", heter det i en hovkommuniké via den statliga nyhetsbyrån SPA.
Tills vidare styrs världens största oljemakt av en yngre vikarie, den cirka 80-årige kronprins Sultan. Inga antydningar har getts om när Abdullah kan resa hem.

description.hltext_display: Nike上季財報跳 盤後股價摔
description.content:
耐吉上季獲利大幅成長，但因接單不如預期，盤後股價重挫。圖為耐吉執行長帕克。
路透
全球最大運動鞋與服飾製造商耐吉(Nike)上季獲利擴增22%，超越分析師預期，但因為接單情況不理想，且未來面臨的挑戰加深，盤後股價重挫近6%。
耐吉在11月底結束的第二會計季中，獲利達4.57億美元或每股94美分，遠優於去年同季的3億7540萬美元或每股76美分，也超越湯姆遜路透公司調查預測的每股88美分。同季營收則成長10%，達到48億美元，符合分析師的預測。
不過，若排除匯率波動因素不計，耐吉12月到明年4月的訂單總值為77億美元，比去年同期成長11%，但低於彭博調查預測的11.6%。
日本的接單甚至下滑5%，日本市場如今只占耐吉總營收的5%不到，最大市場北美洲則貢獻逾25%的營收。
此外，耐吉預期經濟前景未來將帶來更大的挑戰，可能影響本年度的獲利能力。耐吉公司高層表示，經濟變動對耐吉的衝擊來得比較慢，但不會比較小。
耐吉股價最近幾周持續勁揚，今年來漲幅高達40%，主要便是因為投資人預期耐吉的財報會相當出色。但21日財報發布後，耐吉盤後股價卻重挫5.4美元，以86.9美元成交，比92.3美元的收盤價大跌5.9%。
耐吉執行長帕克說，公司準備選擇性地提高若干產品售價，以因應形勢的變動。他說，耐吉目前的競爭優勢，包括產品需求強勁、高營運效率等，讓公司有相當的餘裕可以應付考驗。他說：「我們仍立於引人羨慕的處境，掌握的機會遠多於挑戰，我相信我們的策略能持續帶來盈利的成長。」
耐吉季報與展望
‧營收48億美元，年增10%
‧獲利4.57億美元，每股賺94美分
‧12月到明年4月訂單總值估年增11%，但低於彭博預測的11.6%

description.hltext_display: Nike's 2Q net income up 22 per cent
description.content:
BEAVERTON, Ore. - Nike Inc.'s second-quarter net income rose 22 per cent to beat estimates as demand for its products rose around the world.
The company said Tuesday that it sold more items at full price and tightly controlled its inventory during the period, which helped offset higher freight costs. But the company warned it faced tougher margin pressures for the remainder of the fiscal year because cotton and freight costs are expected to rise.
The news drove Nike's shares down in after-hours trading after they'd risen for several weeks.
Nike did deliver the strong quarter investors had anticipated, earned $457 million, or 94 cents per share, for the quarter that ended Nov. 30. That's up sharply from the $375 million, or 76 cents per share, it earned a year earlier. And it beats analyst expectations of 88 cents per share, according to a poll by Thomson Reuters.
Nike's revenue increased 10 per cent to $4.8 billion, meeting expectations.
But the company said it expects to face challenges from the larger economy and to its margins in the rest of its fiscal year. Company leaders said Nike has been slower to feel the impact of these changes but it should not be minimized.
In response, CEO Mark Parker said, the company plans to raise some prices selectively. He said the company's current competitive advantages, including strong demand for its products and operational efficiency, will give it the leverage it needs to get through this period.
""We're in the enviable position of having far more opportunities than challenges. I'm confident our strategies can continue to deliver sustainable, profitable growth," Parker said.
Nike also reported that orders for products to be delivered for the upcoming season — considered an indicator of its potential performance — are up 11 per cent worldwide.
Shares of Nike have soared in recent weeks in anticipation of the company's report on the strong quarter, and they hit a year-long high this week. But investors pulled back late Tuesday and sent the shares down $5, more than 5 per cent, to $87.30.

description.hltext_display: 361 Degrees Reports Sales Order Growth of 23% for the Autumn 2011 Season
description.content:
New senior appointments to strengthen the management team
HONG KONG, Dec. 22, 2010 /PRNewswire-Asia/ -- 361 Degrees International Limited ("361 Degrees" or the "Company", together with its subsidiaries, the "Group"; HKEx stock code: 1361), one of the leading sports brand enterprises in China, is pleased to announce that its 2011 Autumn Trade Fair has concluded successfully in the Company's premises at Wuli Industrial Park, Jinjing City, Fujian Province, yesterday. The fair, which kicked off on Wednesday, 15 December, drew a total of about 4,000 visitors, including retail outlet owners and their staff, distributors and trade associates.
Order Value +23%
(as compared with 2010 Autumn Trade Fair)
Volume
-- Apparel +10%
-- Footwear +8%
ASP
-- Apparel +13%
-- Footwear +12%
At the fair, products launched by the Company's new Design and R&D Centre in Guangzhou were displayed for the first time and excited the imagination of many. A brand new range of running shoes, the 3 series, featuring entirely fresh designs and the in-house developed NFO Technology, proved extremely popular with the retailers. Also displayed were also the higher-end, performance-enhancing shoes which were developed as a result of the work done for the Chinese National Teams in the handball, softball and field hockey competitions in the recently concluded 16th Asian Games in Guangzhou.
The 2011 Autumn Collection is expected to be available in the retail outlets for sale from June 2011 onwards.
In line with the established nature of its distributorship model, the discounts on an ex-factory basis will be reduced by 200 basis points from this Autumn Trade Fair.
The Company is also pleased to announce two recent senior hires. Mr. Wang Hongzheng has joined the Company as Vice-President, Operations and Ms. Lydia Zhu as Vice-President, Brand Management. Mr. Wang was most latterly a senior management member at Metersbonwe whilst Ms. Zhu has spent over 10 years with Adidas China in a similar position. Mr. Ding Wuhao, President of the Company, in announcing these appointments, said, "We believe the addition of these two senior positions demonstrate the Company's determination to enhance the depth of its management team. We are confident the Company will build on its strong foundation to sustain growth in the industry."
The Group is also pleased to report it has a retail network of over 7,100 stores as at the end of November, with a good geographical spread, and of which 70% are in Tier 3 or smaller cities.
About 361 Degrees International Limited 361 Degrees International Limited is one of the leading sports brand enterprises in China, possessing brand marketing, research and development, design, manufacturing, distribution and retail capabilities. The Group's products include footwear, apparel, accessories and equipment for sport and leisure uses. The Group has established an extensive supply chain management system through proprietary and sub-contracted manufacturing operations; and an exclusive distribution and retail network in China through distribution via authorized distributors.

description.hltext_display: Coreias: Situação ainda é complicada, alerta a China
description.content:
| Imprimir A China anunciou hoje que a situação na península coreana permanece «complicada» e apelou à moderação das partes, na sequência de manobras militares do exército sul-coreano numa ilha bombardeada por Pyongyang no final de novembro. O porta-voz da diplomacia chinesa, Jiang Yu, disse que a China quer manter conversações «urgentes» entre os seis países envolvidos nas negociações sobre o programa nuclear de Pyongyang, suspenso desde o ano passado.
Esta proposta ainda não foi aceite nem pela Coreia do Sul, nem pelos Estados Unidos ou Japão, que tiveram em dezembro conversações tripartidas sobre o tema, em Washington.
«A situação continua complicada e sensível», disse Jiang. «Apelamos a todas as partes a exercer a moderação», acrescentou.
A Coreia do Norte absteve-se, na segunda-feira, de responder às manobras militares na ilha sul-coreana de Yeonpyeong, onde um bombardeamento matou quatro pessoas - incluindo dois civis - em 23 de novembro.
O regime norte-coreano também anunciou que permitirá que novos inspetores da Agência Internacional de Energia Atómica (AIEA) verifiquem as suas instalações nucleares, depois de ter expulsado em abril de 2009. CONTINUA

description.hltext_display: В Петербурге снова идет снег
Valorización inquieta a Santa Catalina
description.content:
EN LA vereda Santa Catalina no apoyan el cobro de dinero por las obras de construcción de acueducto y alcantarillado. Autoridades de Envigado dicen que con el proyecto se valorizará el sector.
Muy preocupados están algunos habitantes de la Loma del Chocho, en Envigado, por cuenta de las labores de construcción de acueducto y alcantarillado que se adelantan en este sector de la vereda Santa Catalina.
Según relata Juan Camilo Arango, residente de la zona, lo que más inquieta a quienes viven en ella es que una parte del costo del proyecto debería ser financiado por la comunidad.
"El tema de servicios públicos es una obligación del Estado, por lo que es injusto que nos digan que debe hacerse por valorización", comentó Arango.
Más aún, teniendo en cuenta que, como asegura, "la mayoría de la comunidad no pidió que se adelantaran esas obras".
"Cada uno de los propietarios se ocupa de su acueducto y con la acción comunal construimos el alcantarillado y con lo que empezaron a hacer lo van a terminar destruyendo", afirmó el residente.
Como él dice, también resulta inquietante que nunca se le haya avisado a la comunidad de forma previa cuándo comenzarían y finalizarían las obras que son ejecutadas desde hace cerca de cuatro meses.
"Hacen reuniones con los unos y con los otros y les dicen cosas diferentes, lo que genera más desinformación", puntualizó.
Al tema se le suma el problema de la inseguridad que últimamente se ha agudizado en el lugar en donde, desde que empezaron a adelantarse los trabajos, se han presentado 16 atracos.
Además, como lo enfatiza Arango, las tareas de construcción dificultan el acceso a las propiedades por el mal estado de las vías.
Autoridades responden
Sergio Ríos Ospina, coordinador del proyecto de construcción de acueducto y alcantarillado de la vereda Santa Catalina, aseguró que en el año 2008 se realizó la primera reunión con la comunidad para exponerle de qué se iba a tratar el proyecto y se permitió que los habitantes formularan sus opiniones y comentarios frente a los diseños de la obra.
Según recalcó, el mismo año se creó una comisión para que actuara como veedora del proyecto.
"Cada mes hacemos una reunión con la veeduría y cada dos meses con la comunidad para analizar el estado y el avance de los trabajos", dijo el coordinador.
Ríos aseveró que muchas personas de la comunidad estaban solicitando las obras que deben ejecutarse porque "no se tiene alcantarillado para aguas lluvias, lo que desestabiliza los terrenos, el alcantarillado veredal descarga en las quebradas del sector y porque no hay un sistema de acueducto consolidado y el agua no es potable".
El funcionario agregó que el Estado aportará la mitad de los recursos para ejecutar el proyecto pero que los habitantes de la zona también deben contribuir con los gastos porque los terrenos se valorizarán con los arreglos.
"La obra cuenta con plan de impacto comunitario y de manejo ambiental para minimizar los efectos. Con los trabajos el terreno deja de ser un lote y se vuelve un potencial urbanístico", finalizó Ríos.

description.hltext_display: Canadian firm to partner with Tanzania's state mining corporation
description.content:
VANCOUVER - Tanzanian Royalty Exploration Corp. (TSX:TNX) says it has an opportunity to earn a 55 per cent interest in the Buckreef gold project in eastern Africa — formerly a holding of Iamgold Corp. (TSX:IMG).
Tanzania's state mining company, Stamico, would own the rest of the project, which is described as an advanced stage exploration project.
According to Canadian regulatory standards, the property contains about 265,000 ounces of gold on a measured basis, 83,000 ounces on an indicated basis and 507,000 ounces on an inferred basis.
Tanzanian Royalty said Tuesday that a definitive joint venture agreement is expected to be signed "in due course."
It said the Buckreef area has a long history of small-scale mining and exploration work, most of which was undertaken by the United Nations, the Tanzanian Mineral Resources Division, Williamson Diamonds and Iamgold, which brought the Buckreef property to its current stage.

description.hltext_display: Drfiting boat sparks lifeboat launch at North Hoyle windfarm
description.content:
A BOAT was spotted drifting close to an offshore windfarm in a dangerous position sparking a lifeboat launch yesterday
Rhyl's All-Weather RNLI lifeboat was launched at 3.40pm to investigate the vessel.
Holyhead coastguard were called shortly before 3.30pm after the windfarm support vessel "Explorer" discovered an 18ft cockling boat drifting near to the North Hoyle windfarm off the coast.
The boat was drifting in a perilous position to windfarm shipping entering the port of Mostyn and to boats working that were working on the offshore wind turbines.
When the lifeboat crew caught up with it nobody was aboard.
It was not known at the time if the vessel had broken adrift from the River Dee estuary or had been engaged in cockling.
The lifeboat came alongside the vessel and a crew member was put aboard.
After an investigation the vessel was locked, and the mooring line was still in the water.
The lifeboat crew concluded it looked like the boat had come adrift from it' mooring.
But as it was a danger to shipping, the boat was towed back to Rhyl.
A Holyhead coastguard spokesman said: "The owner was contacted regarding his missing vessel and nobody had been hurt.
"So it was a positive outcome for everybody involved.”
Rhyl lifeboat made it back to shore shortly before 4pm.

description.hltext_display: Obamas spionchef missade terrorhärva
description.content:
USA:s spionchef James Clapper hade noll koll när han i en tv-intervju frågades om veckans misstänkta terrorhärva i Storbritannien.
Clapper satt tyst en stund, och sade sedan:
Clapper informerar dagligen president Obama om säkerhetsläget, men erkänner att han vid intervjutillfället inte hade en aning om den brittiska härvan.

description.hltext_display: FRANCE - Mediator : Nicolas Sarkozy s'exprimera en Conseil des ministres
description.content: Le président Nicolas Sarkozy s'exprimera mercredi sur l'affaire du Mediator lors du Conseil des ministres, a-t-on appris mardi auprès de l'Elysée. Ce mardi matin, le porte-parole du gouvernement, François Baroin, a affirmé que le gouvernement voulait "une transparence totale et absolue" sur cette affaire pour déterminer "les failles du système". "C'est une affaire sanitaire grave, c'est indiscutable. Le gouvernement veut une transparence totale et absolue", a déclaré François Baroin sur RTL.Selon les estimations des autorités sanitaires, le Mediator, médicament normalement réservé aux diabétiques en surpoids, mais largement prescrit comme coupe-faim, aurait provoqué la mort de 1 000 à 2 000 personnes.Plus d'informations demain dans votre édition locale de Midi Libre.

description.hltext_display: В Петербурге обнаружен фундамент колокольни Смольного монастыря
description.content: Археологи нашли фундамент колокольни ансамбля Смольного монастыря работы Растрелли. Построить колокольню помешали смерть императрицы Елизаветы и война с Пруссией. Во время раскопок найдены фрагменты посуды XVIII века, изразцы и кирпичи.

description.hltext_display: Mulroney says perimeter deal with U.S. good for Canada, no threat to sovereignty
description.content:
OTTAWA - Former prime minister Brian Mulroney says he believes a new security perimeter arrangement with the U.S. represents no threat to sovereignty but does offer a necessary insurance policy for the Canadian economy.
Mulroney, who negotiated the Free Trade Agreement with the United States, said Tuesday the heightened tension over security as a result of the 9-11 terrorist attacks threatens the free flow of goods across the border, putting at risk a key pillar of the economy.
"I think it's a good idea and I think it's getting closer," he said in an interview with The Canadian Press.
The free trade deal and the subsequent North American Free Trade Agreement that added Mexico to the liberalized trade zone was aimed at removing tariffs from a wide swath of goods exchanged between the three countries.
But none of the leaders who signed NAFTA could have predicted the impact a terrorist attack would have had on trade, Mulroney said.
Trade between Canada and the United States essentially came to a skidding halt after the Sept. 11 attacks and was slowed down considerably in the years that followed as skittish American officials sought to reinforce their borders.
"When we did the Canada-United States free trade agreement and then NAFTA, which has been the driving force of the Canadian economy for the last 15 or 20 years, what it didn't foresee was 9-11 and all the aftershocks of that, the tightening of the border and so on," Mulroney said.
A new perimeter agreement would largely serve to restore the situation to where it stood before 9-11, he said.
Reports have suggested Canada and the U.S. are getting closer to a broad agreement that would see the two countries increase co-operation on security, while seeking to expedite the free flow of commercial goods across the border.
Although the importance of Canada-U.S. trade has diminished somewhat since the recession, the American market still represents 70 per cent of all Canadian exports and Canada remains one of the United States' largest trading partners.
Bilateral trade between the two countries totals about $1.5 billion a day, down from close to $2 billion prior to the recession. About 300,000 people cross the border each day.
Trade Minister Peter Van Loan called the relationship by far the most important for Canada in a recent interview, adding that even a small increase in trade with the U.S. would represent a boon for the economy.
He blamed weak demand in the U.S. for imports for much of the recent decrease in south-bound exports, but added that the thickening border has not helped. It will become a greater impediment once the U.S. economy recovers and Americans start buying more Canadian made goods, including cars, parts, machinery and lumber, he added.
Although there is no agreement or details about what a perimeter deal would look like, concerns are already being raised by some civil society groups, unions and opposition parties about a possible deterioration of Canadian sovereignty.
Analysts say for the U.S. to sign on to easier passage of goods and people across the border, Canada would need to convince Washington it can keep security threats from entering Canada in the first place.
Mulroney said he expects concerns over sovereignty to accelerate if a deal is consummated, but added he is not worried that Canada will be any less independent.
"I've seen this movie before," he said.
"You are talking to a guy who was told in the House of Commons ... that all I wanted was to make Canada the 51st state. I was surrendering sovereignty, that we were going to lose our language, we were going to lose our regional development, we were going to lose our medicare, we were going to lose everything."
More than 20 years after the Canada-U.S. deal and 17 years after Mexico was brought into the arrangement with NAFTA, Mulroney says the worth of the agreements can no longer be seriously questioned.

description.hltext_display: Laura Kleckley
Dos mil policías vigilan el Centro en Navidad
description.content:
Sea que quiera quedarse en Medellín o que decida viajar y pasar la Navidad en otra parte, hágalo tranquilo, que para ambos casos tiene todas las garantías. Eso sí, ponga de su parte.
Si quiere viajar, ya sea a otros departamentos o municipios de Antioquia, puede hacerlo sin problemas, que no hay una sola vía cerrada, confirmó el gerente de Terminales, Santiago Gómez.
El funcionario precisó que tanto en la terminal Sur, como en la Norte, están dadas las garantías para que los viajeros salgan tranquilos a sus paseos. Dijo que hacia todas las regiones están saliendo buses, "todas las empresas de transporte están despachando normalmente sus carros".
Admitió, eso sí, que hay varios tramos de vías con paso restringido, pero que no impiden ni la salida ni la llegada de viajeros.
"Lo que sí recomendamos es que la gente tome los buses en las terminales, usando las empresas que operan legalmente; hay que recordar que cuando la gente compra un tiquete a la vez está adquiriendo un seguro de viaje", lo que no obtiene cuando aborda el bus en las carreteras, a veces buscando una rebaja en el precio, alertó.
A su vez, el secretario de Tránsito, Ricardo Smith, invitó a los usuarios de las vías a ser prudentes y cautelosos. Informó que con un grupo de 150 guardas, su dependencia estará controlando el éxodo y el retorno de viajeros.
Éstos están ubicados estratégicamente en las entradas y salidas de la ciudad, pero también en puntos clave de movilidad, como la Curva del Diablo, el desvío al Túnel de Occidente por la vía al Mar, la Loma de Los Balsos, las autopistas Norte y Sur y Las Palmas.
Sobre esta carretera que va al Oriente aclaró que no está cerrada, como muchos creen, que el paso está interrumpido en el kilómetro 7 + 300, pero que la vía se puede retomar por Los Balsos y por la loma del Escobero.
"Seguiremos con los operativos contra la embriaguez, que este año nos han dado excelentes resultados, logramos una reducción del 56 por ciento respecto a 2007 en cuanto al número de personas embriagadas implicadas en accidentes", comentó.
La Policía, a su vez, estableció una vigilancia cuadra por cuadra en el perímetro del Centro, que por esta época es muy acechado por cosquilleros y atracadores.
"Tenemos 2.000 hombres dedicados exclusivamente a esa tarea", informó el coronel Mauricio Cartagena, comandante operativo de la Policía Metropolitana.
Habitualmente, 350 hombres prestan vigilancia en el Centro, sostuvo el comandante del Distrito Centro, coronel Haidiber Restrepo.
Confirmó que de otras regiones llegaron refuerzos, igual que los nuevos policías graduados de la escuela Carlos Holguín, alrededor de 300 efectivos.

description.hltext_display: Lululemon voluntarily withdraws certain reusable bags over lead concerns
description.content: Canadian yoga retailer Lululemon Athletica is voluntarily withdrawing certain reusable bags, shown in this photo taken Tuesday Dec. 21, 2010, from its stores over concern they may contain lead. Lululemon says there is no concern with the use of the bag, only a potential concern with its proper disposal after use. THE CANADIAN PRESS

description.hltext_display: Bamburullstolar till japanskt flyg
description.content:
Japan Airlines (JAL) har kommit på ett sätt för rullstolsburna flygpassagerare att slippa tidsödande extrakontroller - rullstolar av bambu.
"Med en rullstol i bambu kan fysiskt utsatta passagerare färdas snabbt till gaten, de förblir sittande genom säkerhetskontrollen", heter det i ett pressmeddelande från JAL.
De sofistikerade fordonen går loss på 600 000 yen (50 000 kronor) styck, och införs på japanska flygplatser under 2011.

description.hltext_display: Lenfest scholarship deadline approaches
description.content:
Juniors from Franklin County high schools can now apply for a Lenfest College Scholarship worth up to $12,000 a year for four years of a student's college career.
The program provides support to deserving students. Applications are available at all Franklin County high schools and at the Lenfest Foundation website, http://www.lenfestfoundation.org.
The application deadline is Feb. 1.

description.hltext_display: Panel urges better environmental monitoring of oilsands, Ottawa promises action
description.content:
Environment Minister John Baird smiles at members of the media as he follows Chair of the Oil Sands Advisory Panel Elizabeth Dowdeswell following a press conference releasing the panel's assessment and recommendations on research and monitoring of the oilsands, in Ottawa on Tuesday, December 21, 2010. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Pawel Dwulit
OTTAWA - A high-level advisory panel has told Ottawa and Alberta to put politics aside and set up a world-class environmental monitoring system for the Alberta oilsands.
But within hours of the release of the panel's report Tuesday urging the two governments to iron out their jurisdictional issues, there were already signs of federal-provincial friction.
In Ottawa, federal Environment Minister John Baird said he would start implementing the panel's recommendations immediately, putting Environment Canada in charge of setting up a new water-quality monitoring system.
But in Edmonton, Premier Ed Stelmach suggested Alberta should take the lead. His provincial environment minister launched a separate revamping of the monitoring system just this week.
"Those resources are owned by Albertans. There is some cross-jurisdictional responsibility on the environment, but I am very confident that we are doing a good job in monitoring," Stelmach told an Alberta radio station.
Baird said he was willing to work with Stelmach, and Stelmach said he was ready to co-operate — but only to a point.
"I am taking the minister at his word, but I can assure you that if there is some interference that is not based on scientific evidence, then we are going to take them to task," Stelmach said.
The advisory panel of scientists — convened in September by former federal environment minister Jim Prentice — warned that the public has no clear idea what the impact of the oilsands has been, because data has not been collected and sorted in an organized way.
Monitoring is done by a "fragmented" array of authorities and groups, with no established baselines for comparisons and no overarching, integrated view of the entire ecosystem, panel chairwoman Elizabeth Dowdeswell told a news conference.
"There is clearly a lack of leadership and co-ordination," said Dowdeswell, former head of the United Nations environment program.
"Until these significant shortcomings are addressed, there will continue to be debate about the data. There will continue to be uncertainty and public distrust, both of industry's environmental performance and governments' oversight."
The report pointed out that key pieces of data were handed over to the Alberta environment ministry once a year in hard copy only.
"It's pretty damning," federal Liberal environment critic Gerard Kennedy said. "It's as damning as science gets. Canadians have been unprotected all these years" by lack of standards.
The panel recommended a new system be set up to establish baselines, collect all the relevant data, and refer it to a group of renowned scientists for review.
It also said Environment Canada was widely recognized as having the capacity to lead the effort. But it said science clearly needs to trump politics in analyzing the impact of the oilsands.
"Do we have a world-class monitoring system in place? In short, no. But we could have," said Dowdeswell.
The industry's future depends on having a credible system in place, the panel said.
Despite Ottawa's frequent claims in the past that the oilsands industry is well monitored, Baird agreed with the panel's analysis and recommendations.
"We heard the panel's message loud and clear. And we are ready to act," Baird said at the same news conference.
"Obviously we're concerned, and we want to up our game."
He emphasized that the new framework will be transparent, with methodology and findings available to the public at no charge.
The new framework will set "the gold standard of sustainability and stewardship," Baird vowed.
He agreed with the panel's recommendation that industry should pay for the monitoring system. But he did not say how companies would cover the costs, nor did he venture a guess at how expensive it would be.
Despite the prospect of extra charges, the business community did not immediately attack the recommendations. Rather, like the panel itself, the oil and gas industry association urged Ottawa and Alberta to quit squabbling over jurisdiction and get on with the job.
"We certainly look to the two levels of government to iron out jurisdictional issues so we can all work toward solutions," said Travis Davies, a spokesman for the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers.
"We think it's important, especially if you're going to look at a user-pay model, where industry is paying, that we do not have duplicity, that we have an efficient system that arrives at the outcomes that Canadians expect."
Environmentalists, too, urged the governments to co-operate.
But Professor David Schindler — a world-renowned University of Alberta water expert whose findings prompted governments to look more closely at how they monitor the oilsands — said Ottawa needs to take charge.
He said the federal government has clear jurisdiction to take the lead in monitoring because it has responsibility for fisheries, cross- boundary water, national parks and aboriginal people.

I am taking the minister at his word, but I can assure you that if there is some interference that is not based on scientific evidence, then we are going to take them to task
he was willing to work with Stelmach, and Stelmach said he was ready to co-operate ? but only to a point
It's pretty damning; It's as damning as science gets. Canadians have been unprotected all these years

description.hltext_display: Comcast airs holiday messages from troops
description.content:
For the seventh consecutive year, Comcast is offering Troop Greetings On Demand at no additional cost to its Xfinity TV customers through the end of January. The video greetings are now accessible under the "Get Local" section of Comcast's On Demand menu.
Troop Greetings On Demand delivers holiday greetings from military personnel stationed overseas for their loved ones to watch as often as they wish.
To compile Troop Greetings On Demand, Comcast secured hundreds of videotapes from Army/Air Force Hometown News Service and edited them into short video greetings.
Each message includes the service member's name and hometown, and some messages even include the service member's spouse and children. Featured messages are from military personnel and civilian staff stationed around the world.

description.hltext_display: 2 sex crimes cases progress to Franklin County court
description.content:
Two Franklin County men accused of sex crimes against children waived their preliminary hearings Tuesday, and are scheduled to appear in court again in February.
Ryan Lee Bingaman, 21, of 10325 South Mountain Road, Fayetteville, is charged with indecent assault and corruption of minors. His mandatory arraignment is now set for Feb. 2.
According to a police document filed with Magisterial District Judge Kelly Rock, Bingaman inappropriately touched a 12-year-old girl several times during a neighborhood gathering Oct. 23 on South Mountain Road in Quincy Township.
The alleged victim described Bingaman as a "family friend" and told police that he grabbed her several times despite her repeated protests. At one point he allegedly told her, "you better not tell your mom," according to police.
On Dec. 1, Bingaman provided a written statement to police acknowledging he had touched the girl as she described. He was taken before Rock on the charges last week, placed in Franklin County Jail, then released on $5,000 bail.
Timothy Peck Linn Jr., 25, of 7350 Cumberland Highway, is charged with corruption of minors and unlawful contact with a minor using a computer. He also waived his hearing Tuesday, and a mandatory arraignment is set for Feb. 9.
Police allege that in March, Linn met a 17-year-old girl and a 16-year-old-boy online, then had intercourse with them at a local hotel.
He is also accused of performing a sexual act in front of a webcam while
chatting online with a 14-year-old boy. According to police documents, images from the exchange have been collected from the victim's computer hard drive.
Charges were filed Friday, Oct. 29 with Magisterial District Judge David Plum. Linn was incarcerated the same day, then released the following Monday on $20,000 bail.
------------
Jim Tuttle can be reached at jtuttle@publicopinionnews.com or at 262-4754.

description.hltext_display: China: Pequim e Taipé aumentam números de vistos para ilhas
description.content:
Pequim e Taipé decidiram aumentar o número de vistos para turistas chineses visitarem Taiwan e melhorar a proteção dos seus investimentos, indicaram dois delegados na sequência da visita de um emissário especial da China às ilhas.
«As discussões regulares entre as duas partes garantiram a paz e a prosperidade no estreito de Taiwan e na região», disse o chefe da delegação de Taiwan, Chiang Pin-Kung.
Apesar de não manterem relações oficiais, este foi o sexto encontro do género desde 2008 e da eleição do Presidente de Taiwan, Ma Ying-Jeou, favorável a uma retomada das relações com Pequim.
Taiwan é independente desde 1949, mas Pequim considera a ilha como seu território e não exclui o recurso à força para a reintegrar.
No âmbito do acordo com a China, Taipé vai ter quatro mil vistos por dia para turistas, a partir de 01 de janeiro, contra os três mil que tem atualmente.
De janeiro a meados de dezembro visitaram Taiwan 1,13 milhões de turistas chineses.
Segundo as autoridades de Taiwan, o setor turístico do país é o que regista a maior taxa de crescimento da Ásia devido ao fluxo dos chineses continentais, que estão autorizados a visitar Taiwan desde julho de 2008.

description.hltext_display: Indian entrepreneurs stress levels up: Survey
PPG Industries to pay $3.75 million in fines for China unit exports to Pakistan reactor
description.content:
SHANGHAI - A Chinese subsidiary of U.S.-based PPG Industries Inc. has pled guilty to violating U.S. export controls by exporting high-tech coatings to a nuclear reactor in Pakistan, the U.S. Commerce Department said.
PPG and its wholly owned subsidiary PPG Paints Trading (Shanghai) Co. will pay a combined $3.75 million in fines and forfeit the $32,319 earned by the deal, said a statement seen Wednesday on the website of the department's Bureau of Industry and Security.
It said the fine is one of the biggest ever paid for an export violation. The coatings were sent from the United States to the Pakistan's Chashma 2 Nuclear Power Plant via a Chinese distributor.
Chashma 2 is a nuclear power plant under construction near Kundian, in Pakistan's Punjab province.
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania-based PPG issued a statement saying it acted quickly to investigate and co-operate with the authorities after learning of the violation and has a "long and sustained commitment to compliance with the law."
PPG Paints Trading also will serve five years of "corporate probation" under a plea agreement in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia in Washington, D.C.
The fine includes $2 million to be paid by PPG Paints Trading and civil penalties of $1.75 million to be paid by PPG Industries and the subsidiary.
The Bureau of Industry and Security will also audit export transactions of PPG and its "relevant business units" in 2011 and 2012, it said.
"This case demonstrates our resolve to vigorously enforce U.S. export law," U.S. Attorney Ronald C. Machen said in the statement. "It should also serve as a warning to corporations that would violate U.S. export laws. It is not only unlawful, it is also bad business."
The violations, between about June 2006 and March 2007, involved exporting the coatings to the Pakistani nuclear facility without having first obtained a required export license.
Pakistan's Atomic Energy Commission and its facilities were added to a list of prohibited export end users following Pakistan's first successful detonation of a nuclear device in 1998.
According to the Commerce Department, PPG Paints Trading sought and failed to get an export license and later agreed to sell the coatings via another, unnamed distributor in China, which was to deliver the products to Pakistan.

event_or_fact.property: This case demonstrates our resolve to vigorously enforce U.S. export law; It should also serve as a warning to corporations that would violate U.S. export laws. It is not only unlawful, it is also bad business.

description.hltext_display: RSVP of the Capital Region links volunteers with nonprofit groups
description.content:
A nonprofit group billing itself as an employment agency for volunteers is expanding its services in Chambersburg.
RSVP of the Capital Region Inc. provides support for volunteers, especially seniors 55 or older, by providing mileage reimbursement and accident and liability insurance while they are volunteering.
The 501c(3) nonprofit is active in Adams, Cumberland, Dauphin, Franklin and Perry counties, providing volunteers to serve at posts or "stations" such as nonprofit organizations, government agencies, hospitals and schools.
RSVP spokeswoman Jan Zimmerman said RSVP enrolled the Chambersburg Area School District as a station for volunteer reading tutors earlier this year. To date, 15 volunteers have signed up to work as tutors for students needing additional help.
In addition to providing the volunteers with mileage reimbursement, up to $35 a month, for driving to their assignments, RSVP has paid for the required security clearances they need to work with children in public schools.
"Too often, seniors aged 55 and older would like to volunteer their time and service but because they must live on a fixed income, they can't afford the extra expense to travel to a service post," said Zimmerman, who is the organization's Cumberland and Franklin counties area coordinator.
She said that in addition to helping with the out-of-pocket costs of volunteering, RSVP has an annual event where volunteers are publicly recognized.
They receive awards and
are treated to food, dancing and prizes at those functions, she said.
RSVP also creates and operates programs in the fields of tutoring children, mentoring children and teens, environmental monitoring and education and computer education for seniors. The agency has provided volunteer placement services since 1972.
----------
Vicky Taylor can be reached at 262-4753 or vtaylor@publicopinionnews.com.
What you can do
For information on becoming a volunteer or about RSVP, call Jan Zimmerman at 1-800-870-2616.

description.hltext_display: AM Ann Jones critical of cuts of 121 police officers in North Wales
description.content:
Police patrol Rhyl promenade
A NORTH Wales AM yesterday criticised plans to axe 121 police officers as ‘a gamble with our safety’.
Labour AM in Vale of Clwyd Ann Jones reacted angrily to plans to axe the officers plus a similar number of civilian staff.
The North Wales Police Authority will soon be replaced with an elected commissioner by the UK Coalition Government .
According to the British Crime Survey, North Wales is the safest place to live in the UK as crime fell by a third under three periods of Labour Government.
But Ms Jones said: "This reckless Government is risking throwing away the huge success story that is North Wales Police.
"As well as targeting criminals and making huge progress, the authority has always tried to improve its efficiency.
"From assault and other violent offences, to burglary and vehicle theft, our force has delivered concrete success that you can see on a day to day basis.
"The idea of an elected police commissioner is bonkers. I want the police chief in my area to be a top class professional who will tell us what needs doing and make tough decisions.”
Chief Constable Mark Polin announced the cutbacks to save £15m needed after budget reductions. "We need to makes betters use of the fewer resources than we have,” he said.

description.hltext_display: Chambersburg stabbing case heads for Franklin County court
description.content:
The case of a Chambersburg man accused of repeatedly stabbing his wife in July is moving forward in the Franklin County court system.
Justin Scott Quick, 27, waived his preliminary hearing Tuesday, according to the central court administrator's office. A mandatory arraignment is slated for Feb. 2.
He remains in Franklin County Jail in lieu of $850,000 bail, charged with attempted criminal homicide, two counts of aggravated assault and resisting arrest. He is being represented by Public Defender Ian Brink.
Chambersburg Police allege that Quick stabbed his wife, Pennie Quick, repeatedly with a large kitchen knife on the night of July 30. He is also accused of stabbing his wife's friend, Yolanda Lee Thomas, when she tried to intervene.
According to charging documents, the first officer on the scene, patrolman Rob Peterson, attempted to subdue Quick with a Taser, but the man still refused to drop the knife. Peterson had to punch him several times in the head until he finally submitted to the arrest.
Pennie Quick was reportedly stabbed eight times in the back and flown to York Hospital for treatment. She said in an August interview that her husband became upset after she asked him if she could spend the night at her friend's house.
------------
Jim Tuttle can be reached at jtuttle@publicopinionnews.com or at 262-4754.

description.hltext_display: Mueren cuatro soldados en campo minado
description.content:
Cuando realizaban labores de inspección y control de área en zona rural del municipio de Anorí, murieron, en un campo minado, cuatro militares, adscritos al batallón Bomboná, de la Decimacuarta Brigada del Ejército.
El ataque ocurrió en la vía Anorí-Dos Bocas, en la vereda Cruces, una zona selvática, límites de Anorí y Zaragoza, en el nordeste de Antioquia.
Allí los militares detectaron el movimiento de una facción del frente 36 de las Farc y se registró un combate en el cual los subversivos activaron un campo minado en el que cayeron un suboficial y tres soldados.
En helicóptero fueron trasladados a la morgue del hospital La Cruz, de Puerto Berrío, donde está la sede de la Brigada, los cadáveres del cabo Diego Fernando Huertas, oriundo de Ibagué (Tolima), y los soldados Jorge Iván Montoya, del municipio de Yolombó, nordeste de Antioquia; John Édison Ayala, de Guarne, y Húber Darío Muñoz, de Medellín.
No se informó si en la respuesta de las tropas se presentaron bajas entre los subversivos.
Al sitio fueron enviados refuerzos con el fin de contactar a los guerrilleros y rastrear la zona para verificar si quedaron más campos minados.
En Anorí las autoridades y voceros de la ciudadanía expresaron preocupación por este hecho ya que deja en evidencia la forma como el frente 36 de las Farc trata de extender su accionar hacia el nordeste minero de Antioquia, aprovechando la zona selvática, la cual es talada para la siembra de plantas de hoja de coca, e instalación de laboratorios para la producción de cocaína, con la cual se financia este frente.
Ante los contundentes golpes del Ejército y la Policía Antinarcóticos en el norte de Antioquia, que han arrasado con extensas zonas de cultivos de coca con el que se sostiene económicamente este frente, en los últimos meses se ha detectado su desplazamiento hacia zonas montañosas y selváticas del Bajo Cauca y Nordeste minero de Antioquia.
De igual manera en Anorí recordaron que transitar por las zonas rurales de la población es una angustiosa lotería, por la cantidad de campos minados sembrados por esta facción de la guerrilla, los cuales han dejado mutilados a varios campesinos de la localidad.

description.hltext_display: Japan exports rise 9.1 per cent in November, but trade surplus shrinks
description.content:
TOKYO - Japan says its exports in November rose 9.1 per cent from a year earlier.
The Ministry of Finance says the value of Japanese exports expanded to 5.4 trillion yen ($64.4 billion). It says it was the 12th consecutive monthly growth.
But the nation's trade surplus contracted 55.4 per cent in November, marking the first decline in three months.
The ministry said Wednesday that exports to China, Japan's biggest trading partner, increased 18.3 per cent in November from a year earlier. U.S.-bound shipments grew just 1.2 per cent, while those to the European Union rose 10.1 per cent in the month.

description.hltext_display: Restaurant inspection reports from across Pennsylvania to be available online
description.content:
New food safety regulations in Pennsylvania will make it easier to access restaurant inspection results online.
Under the new law, which takes effect Jan. 22, consumers will be able to find inspections for all Pennsylvania restaurants at one website -- http://eatsafepa.com.
The new law brings some uniformity and transparency to the restaurant inspection process in Pennsylvania.
The state Department of Agriculture oversees the inspection of eating and drinking establishments, but some local municipalities -- including Chambersburg -- opt to do their own inspections.
Under the new law, local jurisdictions that do their own restaurant inspections will now be required to submit results to the Department of Agriculture's online database.
As things stand, local jurisdictions with their own inspections publish results on different websites, or sometimes not at all. The Borough of Chambersburg posts restaurant inspections on Commonwealth Code Inspection Services' website.
The new law also requires that inspections are posted online to the EatSafePA database within 30 days of completion, so that consumers have access to up-to-date information.
The Department of Agriculture said there are 167 local jurisdictions that perform their own safety inspections of an estimated 60,000 retail food facilities. Under the old law, each of those jurisdictions was allowed to have its own inspection procedures and reporting mechanisms.
"Clearly, one of the benefits is that the new law provides a single minimal standard across the state," said Martin Bucknavage, a food safety expert at Penn State's College of Agricultural Sciences. "The law will use the current U.S. Food and Drug Administration Food Code as a standard, and so Pennsylvania regulations across the state will stay current as the Food Code is updated."
In addition to the reporting requirements, the new law increases fees for inspections and maximum amounts for civil and criminal penalties for non-compliance.
The new law also requires that each retail food facility have one food-safety certified employee who is accredited by a nationally recognized program. That employee must be the "person in charge" when at the facility and accessible at all times, either in person or by phone, during the hours of operation.
------------
Marcus Rauhut can be reached at mrauhut@publicopinionnews.com and 262-4752.
Restaurant inspections

Outside the borough:

description.hltext_display: Огни на главной елке Башкирии зажгли сразу два Президента
Fund set up for final expenses of 4 Chambersburg residents who perished in car crash
description.content:
CHAMBERSBURG -- A memorial fund has been established to help pay for the final arrangements of four people who died in a Sunday auto accident.
The fund will offset the $12,000 cost of getting the bodies of the four young adults cremated and inurned so they can be returned to the Dominican Republic for burial, according to Marilyn Ross, Chambersburg Hispanic American Center board president.
Ross said the fund has been set up through a local bank to keep donations separate from other CHAC funds.
Feliz J. Perez-Cenas, 24, Dorian M. Sanchez-Reyes, 25, Tomas A. Ramirez, 18, and Cecilia M. Ramirez, 22, died in the 2:08 a.m. Sunday accident on Wayne Avenue. A 17-year-old girl in the car was flown to Milton S. Hershey Medical Center, Hershey, where she remains in critical condition.
Ross said the center will work to get financial help for her at a later date.
"Given time constraints, we needed to make arrangements quickly for the four deceased young men and woman," she said.
The names of the four are linked to the memorial fund and money it receives will be divided evenly between the families. CHAC is representing the families and providing guidance to them, Ross said.
Several family members had already made plans and have airline tickets to go to the Dominican Republic this week for a family reunion. Ross said they would like to take the remains with them.
Ross said the four young people, born and raised in Chambersburg, were well known among
both Hispanics and non-Hispanics in the community. Their parents are immigrants from the Dominican Republic and they have extended family in that country.
A Mass was celebrated in Spanish by Father Ignacio Palomino Monday night at Corpus Christi Catholic Church, Chambersburg, in remembrance of the four young people.
----------
Vicky Taylor can be reached at 262-4753 or vtaylor@publicopinionnews.com.
What you can do
Contributions in the form of checks can be made payable to CHAC Memorial Fund and sent to CHAC at 252 S. Main St., Chambersburg 17201.

description.hltext_display: Negotiating teams report progress toward contract for Chambersburg Area School District teachers
description.content:
CHAMBERSBURG -- A nine-hour negotiating session Tuesday reportedly resulted in progress toward a new teacher contract between Chambersburg Area School District and the Chambersburg Area Education Association.
According to a joint statement released Tuesday night, the two sides "were able to make progress on several issues. Another bargaining session is scheduled for January 10, 2010, to continue negotiations."
The two sides began negotiating a new contract in January. They failed to agree before the previous contract expired over the summer.
Negotiations continued until an independent fact-finder was requested from the state in November. Since the fact-finder released her report, CAEA has twice voted to accept it, while the school board voted to reject it twice, the most recent vote taken during a special meeting Monday afternoon.
Last week, the union voted to authorize a strike if necessary.
The fact-finder's recommendation is a raise for each of the next three years of 1.79 percent, 1.5 percent and 1.79 percent, respectively, plus step increases; and fair share, which is a requirement that non-union members pay a fee to reimburse the union for bargaining on their behalf.
Public Opinion has not been able to verify reports of the step increases.
In previous statements, school board members have cited the fair share language as a deciding factor in declining the report. On Monday, board members cited the financial situation of the district
and an expected lack of strong state funding to reject the report because of wage increase recommendations.

description.hltext_display: American Airlines stops selling tickets through Orbitz; could make fare comparisons tougher
description.content:
American Airlines pulled its flights from the Orbitz travel website on Tuesday in a dispute that could eventually affect the way travellers buy airplane tickets online.
The airline said its tickets sold previously on Orbitz are still valid. And American Airlines tickets can still be bought at the airline's own website as well as other travel websites. American pulled its tickets from the Orbitz for Business site as well.
The dispute is the latest sign of strains between airlines and the companies that sell airline tickets, including online sellers like Orbitz.
Airlines have traditionally paid sellers a commission. American also pays fees to the global distribution companies that provide the flight information.
Now, American wants Orbitz to get that flight information directly from the airline, cutting out the global distribution systems. American has said that will reduce costs and also allow it to make more personalized offers to customers such as hotels and car rentals.
The global distribution systems have not moved as fast as they could have to upgrade their technology, but American's move with Orbitz is "rather severe," said Henry Harteveldt, a travel analyst for Forrester Research. "It seems like they want to scorch the earth."
He predicted that travellers who want to fly on American will seek out its tickets on the airline's website. Travelers who don't know what happened with Orbitz, or don't care which airline they fly, are unlikely to notice American's absence from Orbitz, he said.
Traveller advocates have said American's move will make it harder to comparison shop.
"There is profit in confusion, there is profit in fragmentation of all the fares and the fees so consumers can't comparison shop," said Kevin Mitchell, chairman of the Business Travel Coalition, which represents corporate travel buyers.
He said airlines ultimately would like to flip the current financial arrangement around and have travel agents pay them for access to flight information, rather than American paying every time someone else sells a ticket on one of its flights.
American's vice-president for sales, Derek DeCross, said in a statement that the airline needs to be "free to customize its product offerings to improve the customer experience as well as distribute its products in a way that does not result in unnecessary costs."
American had threatened to pull out of Orbitz on Dec. 1. But Orbitz got a state court judge in Chicago to block the threat temporarily. It made its move on Tuesday shortly after judge Martin S. Agran declined to issue an injunction. Agran ruled that any breach of contract can be sorted out with a lawsuit later.
The request to block American was brought by privately held Travelport Ltd., which owns 48 per cent of Orbitz. It also runs two of the biggest so-called global distribution systems, Galileo and Worldspan. American spokesman Ryan Mikolasik said it has been negotiating with other online ticket sellers. The Orbitz negotiation was made more difficult because of Travelport's involvement as owner of the two global distribution systems, he said.
Orbitz Worldwide Inc. called American's decision "unfortunate" and said it still offers flights from more than 400 airlines worldwide and would continue to seek a way to sell American tickets, too. It said American Airlines tickets add-ons like rental cars and hotel rooms added up to about 5 per cent of the company's revenue for the nine months that ended Sept. 30. It said it believes that any American Airlines tickets it loses will be replaced by tickets on other airlines.
Shares of American parent AMR Corp. rose 14 cents to close at $8.05. Orbitz shares rose 22 cents, or 3.5 per cent, to close at $6.44, but then fell 16 cents, or 2.5 per cent, to $6.28 in aftermarket trading.
Also Tuesday, Delta Air Lines Inc. said it would stop selling tickets through three smaller travel websites, CheapOAir.com, OneTravel.com, and BookIt.com effective on Dec. 17.
Last week a Delta executive told analysts that some ticket venues have more value than others. The airline wants "as direct a relationship and channel to our best customers as we can," said Glenn Hauenstein, Delta's executive vice-president for network planning, revenue management, and marketing. He said he's aiming for Delta's own website to be more like an Apple store and suggested that other travel websites are more like Best Buy, with similar products, but a different customer experience, he said.
___
Freed reported from Minneapolis. AP Airlines Writer David Koenig in Dallas contributed to this report.

description.hltext_display: Hours after release from jail, Chambersburg man sought for attempted murder
description.content:
David Dalton Garner
A Chambersburg man had been out of jail mere hours before police began looking for him in connection with an incident of attempted homicide.
According to Pennsylvania State Police, Chambersburg, David Dalton Garner, 24, of 45 Greenlea Way, allegedly stabbed a St. Thomas man in the head, tried to suffocate him with a plastic bag, and then choked him with a belt.
When the victim's mother returned home during the incident, which began about 2:30 p.m. Monday, Garner allegedly bound and robbed her, eventually fleeing with cash, credit cards and her vehicle, police said.
Garner remained at large Tuesday night. Police said the public should keep in mind that Garner apparently targeted the victim because they knew each other, but he should still be considered armed and dangerous.
When he spoke with police Monday afternoon, Micah McGowan, 25, suffered from a stab wound on the left side of his head, a cut on the back of his head, strangulation marks on his neck and bruises on his face, according to a police. Chambersburg Hospital said Tuesday night that McGowan had since been discharged.
He told investigators that Garner was a "past friend" whom he had not seen in nearly nine months. In a statement issued Tuesday, police said the men "had been friends through grade school."
A Franklin County Jail representative confirmed that Garner was released Monday morning after serving nearly nine months, since March 31. According to court records, he pleaded guilty
in 2009 to receiving stolen property, unauthorized use of a motor vehicle and huffing a toxic substance.
Police filed new charges against Garner early Tuesday. He faces counts of attempted criminal homicide, aggravated assault, and two counts of robbery, all first-degree felonies. He is also charged with robbery, theft, unlawful restraint and simple assault.
Police said Garner showed up about 2:30 p.m. Monday at McGowan's home at 4746 Heckman Drive, St. Thomas. McGowan invited Garner inside, and gave him a drink of water. They went upstairs to watch television in McGowan's bedroom.
After watching TV for a while, McGowan went to his desk to work on Christmas cards, according to police. While he was doing that, Garner allegedly hit him from behind, in the head, with a bathroom scale.
McGowan got up and headed for the bedroom door when Garner pulled a knife and stabbed him in the side of his head, according to police. McGowan said he passed out and woke up face down on the floor with his hands tied behind his back.
Garner allegedly put a plastic Wal-Mart bag over the bound man's head. McGowan told police he could not breath at first, but managed to bite a hole in the bag with his teeth.
Next, Garner allegedly put a bathrobe belt around the victim's neck and began strangling him from behind and asking where his valuables were. They went downstairs to the living room just before Micah McGowan's mother, Mary McGowan, 54, returned home about 4 p.m.
She later told police that when she came in the back door, she heard her son yell, "Mom, run!" just before Garner appeared and ran toward her with a knife.
Garner allegedly forced the woman to lie face down on the floor. When she asked what he was doing, he told her that "he owed people money," according to police. She told police he took $500 and credit cards from her purse, and made her write him a check for more money.
When Mary McGowan asked Garner if he intended to kill her and her son, he reportedly said no, but refused to let her tend to her son's injuries. He asked if there were any guns in the house, but didn't take them when she said there were.
According to police, Garner "instructed Mary to tell the police she was robbed by black men," and told her that he owed $50,000 to "some bad men" who would hurt her family if law enforcement got involved.
Garner eventually untied the woman and helped Micah into a car so she could take him to Chambersburg Hospital for treatment, police said. He then got in McGowan's other vehicle, a black 2008 Subaru Outback, and followed her out of the driveway.
Sometime before McGowan reached the hospital, Garner stopped following her. Police are now looking for him.
"The resources that we now have working this case are pretty extensive," said Pennsylvania State Police spokesperson Trooper Tom Pinkerton on Tuesday.
Investigators spoke with Garner's girlfriend, Heather Elaine Johnson, shortly before 8 p.m. Monday, according to police.
She told police that after Garner got out of Franklin County Jail at 9 a.m., he walked to a friend's house and called her from a phone belonging to someone named "Lennie" to ask for a ride.
She picked him up and they were together at her house until about 1:45 p.m., when he "asked to borrow her car to go do something." Johnson told police she refused to let him have the car, but agreed to take him. He allegedly directed her to the McGowan house and went to the front door.
Johnson left him there and went to work about 4 p.m. When she last saw Garner, he was wearing a white hooded South Pole shirt, blue jeans and tan boots. She told police that he hadn't mentioned owing money to anyone and that he seemed to be in a good mood.
------------
Jim Tuttle can be reached at jtuttle@publicopinionnews.com or 262-4754.
Be aware
Wanted for attempted homicide, David Dalton Garner should be considered armed and dangerous.
He was last seen wearing a white hooded South Pole shirt, blue jeans and tan boots, and driving a black Subaru Outback with license plate number FCG0481.
Anyone with information about his whereabouts is asked to call Pennsylvania State Police, Chambersburg, immediately, at 264-5161.

description.hltext_display: Förlust i första genrepet inför JVM
description.content:
Det blev förlust för juniorkronorna i det första genrepet inför junior-VM i ishockey. Kanada vann med 4-1 i Toronto, natten mot onsdagen.
Det var en jämn match, Sverige vann skottstatistiken med 30-29, men det var Kanada som gjorde målen.
JVM startar på söndag.

description.hltext_display: Составлена точнейшая карта океанических течений
description.content: Самую точную на сегодняшний день карту океанических течений удалось составить британским специалистам. Как указывает «Компьюлента», в работе ученые опирались на результаты наблюдений европейского спутника GOCE (Gravity field and steady-state Ocean Circulation Explorer) за земной гравитацией.

description.hltext_display: MILLAU - La confédération paysanne manifeste contre l'agneau néo-zélandais
description.content: Une vingtaine de personnes ont manifesté, hier à Millau, à l'appel de la Confédération paysanne afin de dénoncer la vente d'agneau néo-zélandais dans le rayon frais des grandes surfaces. Après avoir investi le Super U de la cité du gant, elles ont été reçues par le sous-préfet, Paul Boulvrais.Plus d'informations demain dans votre édition locale de Midi Libre.

description.hltext_display: Activision targets game rival Electronic Arts in $400 million lawsuit over poached employees
description.content:
LOS ANGELES, Calif. - Activision Blizzard Inc., the video game maker behind the smash-hit shooter "Call of Duty: Black Ops," on Tuesday added a new target in its lawsuit against two former executives: rival Electronic Arts Inc. Activision also put a price tag on its claim for the first time, seeking $400 million.
The amended complaint filed in the Los Angeles Superior Court is the latest salvo in a legal shootout that began when Jason West and Vince Zampella sued Activision for $36 million in March, claiming Activision fired them to avoid paying royalties for their work on the "Call of Duty" franchise.
Activision, owned by France's Vivendi SA, claims EA lured the men away, starting as early as July 2009, despite their having two years left on their contract, in part by using talent agency Creative Artists Agency as an intermediary. It alleges EA dispatched a private jet to Southern California to shuttle West and Zampella to a secret meeting at the home of EA's chief executive John Riccitiello near San Francisco in August 2009.
The two later formed Respawn Entertainment, hiring about 40 employees away from Activision. Respawn said in April it will create games exclusively for release by EA.
In the complaint, Activision alleges that EA intentionally interfered with contracts, engaged in unfair competition and aided and abetted breaches of fiduciary duty by the executives.
EA, which is based in Redwood City, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
West and Zampella did not directly work on the "Black Ops" game, which Activision said Tuesday had exceeded $1 billion in global sales. The men's unit at Activision, Infinity Ward, works on roughly every other game in the "Call of Duty" franchise with Activision subsidiary Treyarch.
Shares of Activision, which is based in Santa Monica, rose 10 cents to $12.33 in after-hours trading on Tuesday, after closing up 2 cents at $12.23. Electronic Arts shares were unchanged in extended trading after closing up 8 cents at $15.93.

description.hltext_display: Разград: Бременна в петия месец е пострадала при катастрофа на пътя между селата Вазово и Райнино
description.content: Разград. Бременна в петия месец жена пострада при катастрофа на пътя между селата Вазово и Райнино. Това съобщиха от Областната дирекция на МВР в Разград. Инцидентът станал около 17.25 часа вчера. 22-годишен мъж от Райнино управлявал лекия автомобил “Ровър – 45” с несъобразена скорост по заледения път. Изгубил контрол над автомобила и се блъснал в крайпътно дърво. При произшествието е пострадала возещата се на задната седалка Н.О. на 19 години от село Райнино. Настанена е в исперихската болница, по първоначални данни няма опасност
