description.hltext_display: Vigilance orange pour 20 départements en prévision de nouvelles chutes de neige
description.content:
Vingt départements de la moitié nord de la France, de la Loire-Atlantique aux Ardennes, ont été placés en vigilance orange par Météo France en raison de chutes de neige attendues mercredi en fin de journée.
Par ailleurs, la vigilance orange est décrétée pour la Moselle et le Bas-Rhin en raison de risques de crue.
Les chutes de neige atteindront de 5 � 10 cm sur les départements de l'Ile-de-France, sur l'Aisne (02), les Ardennes (08), l'Eure (27), l'Eure-et-Loir (28), l'Ille-et-Vilaine (35), la Loire-Atlantique (44), le Maine-et-Loire (49), la Mayenne (53), le Morbihan (56), l'Oise (60), l'Orne (61) et la Sarthe (72).
La pluie traversera dans la matinée l'Aquitaine et les Charentes avant de remonter vers le nord où, en butant sur l'air froid, elle se transformera en neige sur le nord des Pays de la Loire et les collines normandes. "Ces chutes de neige s'étendront en soirée et la nuit suivante au bassin parisien et aux Ardennes et pourraient être précédées d'un peu de verglas", prévient Météo France. "Cet épisode neigeux débutera vers 18h00 sur le Pays de Loire, 19h00 sur l'Ile-de-France, 20h00 sur la Bretagne, le sud de Normandie et la Picardie", selon les prévisionnistes de Météo France.

description.hltext_display: Studenti oggi in piazza. Roma blindata
description.content:
la richiesta al capo dello stato: «non firmi»
Ddl Gelmini: gli studenti promettono
una protesta a suon di ironia e sorpresa
Previsti tre cortei, nessuna certezza sui percorsi. Blitz e flash-mob. Lo slogan: «Liberi per la città»
ROMA - Tornano di nuovo in piazza oggi gli studenti italiani, a Roma e in tante città, in vista dell’approvazione definitiva al Senato del tanto discusso ddl di riforma dell’università: il clou, come sempre, sarà a Roma, messa a ferro e fuoco lo scorso 14 dicembre. Stavolta, però, hanno assicurato gli studenti, la protesta dovrebbe assumere dei toni diversi, anche perchè nessuno dubita che il ddl verrà approvato, nonostante i ritardi per il caos di ieri sul voto degli emendamenti: per le strade della capitale non sfilerà infatti il ’solito’ corteo, il classico serpentone verso i palazzi delle istituzioni. Anzi, la manifestazione dovrebbe addirittura risparmiare il centro storico e non puntare verso il ’triangolo del potere’ Camera-Senato-palazzo Chigi, al quale la scorsa settimana era stato tentato l’assalto da una parte dei manifestanti, con immagini di scontri e devastazioni che hanno fatto il giro del mondo. Gli studenti garantiscono che non sarà violata la zona rossa e che la loro protesta sarà ironica, imprevedibile e fantasiosa. «Lasceremo i palazzi del potere nella solitudine della loro miseria e andremo in altrove».
ZONE VIETATE - Il centro di Roma è comunque blindato, la questura ha previsto istituita una zona di guardia (guarda la mappa) per impedire che manifestanti arrivino nelle zone delle aule parlamentari e della sede del governo. Ma non sembra affatto questa l'intenzione degli studenti che vogliono dimostrare oggi che il loro intento non è di seguire i gruppi teppisti che hanno provocato gli scontri della scorsa settimana., nonostante «il clima provocatorio avuto dalla Questura in questi giorni», spiegano, tant’è che non è stato neanche avanzata alla Questura richiesta di autorizzazione a sfilare in centro. Lo slogan dei blitz del 22 è «Liberi per la città».
PERCORSI TOP SECRET - I primi appuntamenti fissati sono a piazzale Aldo Moro e a Piramide, in entrambi i posti alle 9.30. Da lì gli studenti si sposteranno per la città, seguendo un percorso ’top secret’: tra le possibili sortite improvvise, quella al Ministero dell’Istruzione in Viale Trastevere. A Milano è già fissato un presidio per le 9 davanti alla Statale, in via Festa del Perdono che, in base al numero di partecipanti e al risultato che uscirà da Palazzo Madama, potrebbe trasformarsi in un corteo o in un punto di partenza per le azioni simboliche di piccoli gruppi di studenti. Sul fronte operativo invece una lettera di «richiesta di autorizzazione» della manifestazione di domani, indirizzata al sindaco, al questore e al prefetto di Roma, è stata diffusa dagli studenti della Sapienza. «Lasceremo i palazzi del potere nella solitudine della loro miseria e andremo nella altre zone della città, per parlare con chi come noi è inascoltato da quelli stessi palazzi», affermano tra l'altro gli studenti chiedendo alle autorità: «siete disposti a garantire il diritto di manifestare?». «Con la presente gli studenti e le studentesse della Sapienza comunicano alle autorità che il giorno 22 dicembre sfileranno per le strade di Roma»: comincia così la lettera della Sapienza indirizzata al sindaco di Roma Gianni Alemanno, al questore di Roma Francesco Tagliente e al prefetto di Roma Giovanni Pecoraro.
LETTERA A NAPOLITANO - E oggi verrà consegnata al capo dello Stato una lettera, scritta dai collettivi studenteschi della Sapienza, per chiedergli di non firmare il ddl Gelmini: «Non firmi - dicono gli studenti - sarà così in piazza anche lei al nostro fianco». I collettivi universitari si recheranno inoltre mercoledì, con una delegazione, dal presidente della Repubblica Giorgio Napolitano per interloquire cioè con chi ha detto «che bisogna ascoltare il nostro disagio»: gli sarà quindi recapitata una lettera. Se Napolitano firmerà la legge Gelmini «sancirà la cancellazione del diritto allo studio» scrivono nella lettera al Presidente della Repubblica gli studenti in mobilitazione della Sapienza. In uno dei passaggi cruciali della lettera, affidata all'Ansa, gli studenti scrivono: «Se porrà la Sua firma alla legge Gelmini Lei sancirà la cancellazione del Diritto allo Studio, uno dei diritti fondamentali della Costituzione intesa come patto fondante della nostra società, che garantisce equità e democrazia».
Redazione online
22 dicembre 2010© RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

description.hltext_display: The Pirates of Phuket by The Andaman Players
Weniger schlimm als befürchtet
description.author: Martin Knoepfel
description.content:
Trotz der Krise stieg die Sozialhilfequote im Thurgau 2009 nur von 1,5 auf 1,6 Prozent. Sie liegt damit noch unter dem Niveau von 2006 und unter dem Landesmittel. Sorgen bereitet Fachleuten die im April 2011 in Kraft tretende ALV-Revision. Die Sozialhilfeausgaben stiegen im Thurgau im Jahr 2009 auf 22,53 Millionen Franken. Das sind 7,2 Prozent mehr als im Vorjahr. Es handelt sich dabei um die Nettoausgaben. 3815 Personen waren Ende 2009 auf Sozialhilfe angewiesen, 200 mehr als Ende 2008. Das ist einer Mitteilung der Dienststelle für Statistik von gestern zu entnehmen.
Damit kehrte sich ein seit 2006 anhaltender Trend. 2006 hatte die Sozialhilfequote 1,9 Prozent erreicht. Mit einem Plus von 0,1 Prozentpunkten auf 1,6 Prozent sei die Zunahme geringer ausgefallen als angesichts der Krise befürchtet, heisst es in der Mitteilung. Im Landesmittel betrage die Sozialhilfequote rund drei Prozent, betont Florentina Wohnlich, Leiterin des Kantonalen Fürsorgeamts. Überdurchschnittlich stiegen die Sozialhilfeausgaben 2009 in den Bezirken Arbon, Kreuzlingen und Weinfelden. Dafür waren die drei Städte verantwortlich. Im kantonalen Mittel betrugen die Sozialhilfeausgaben 2009 92 Franken pro Einwohner. Rickenbach, Steckborn, Bischofszell und Arbon mussten dafür über 150 Franken pro Einwohner ausgeben.
2011 Kostenschub erwartet
Die Sozialhilfe reagiert mit Verzögerung auf die Konjunkturentwicklung. Da stellt sich die Frage, wie sich die Sozialhilfeausgaben 2010 entwickeln. Eine Umfrage bei grösseren Gemeinden ergab ein gemischtes Bild.
In Arbon betrug die Sozialhilfequote Ende 2009 4,1 Prozent – nach einem so turbulenten Anstieg, wie ihn der Leiter der Sozialen Dienste Hans-Jürg Fenner noch nie erlebt hatte. Dieses Jahr gab die Sozialhilfequote wieder auf 3,5 Prozent nach. Turi Schallenberg, Leiter Sozialhilfe von Weinfelden, rechnet hingegen damit, dass die Sozialhilfeausgaben im laufenden Jahr tiefer ausfallen als budgetiert. Die Zahl der Fälle sinke. Eine genaue Statistik führe man nicht.
Ruth Müller, Leiterin der Sozialen Dienste der Stadt Bischofszell, und Anneliese Zingg, Amtsleiterin Sozialdienste der Stadt Frauenfeld, rechnen dieses Jahr mit weitgehend unveränderten Fallzahlen. In Frauenfeld steigen allerdings die Kosten dennoch. Unter anderem spürt die Stadt Sparmassnahmen der IV. Zudem stellten verschiedene Firmen einen Teil des Personals nur über Temporärfirmen an, sodass Klienten der Sozialhilfe immer weniger Feststellen erhielten.
Alfred Saam, Leiter Sozialdienste der Stadt Kreuzlingen, geht für dieses Jahr hingegen von einer Zunahme der Sozialhilfequote von 3,6 auf 3,7 oder 3,8 Prozent aus. Dennoch werde Kreuzlingen für die Sozialhilfe dieses Jahr weniger ausgeben müssen als budgetiert. Fenner, Saam und Zingg befürchten jedoch übereinstimmend einen Kos-tenschub wegen der jüngsten ALV-Revision. Diese tritt Anfang April 2011 in Kraft. Dann dürfte ein Schub ausgesteuerter Arbeitsloser bei den Sozialämtern vorsprechen. Zudem werden Beschäftigungsprogramme weniger attraktiv, da sie keine neue Rahmenfrist der ALV mehr generieren. Sie fürchte die Folgen der ALV-Revision schon etwas, räumt Wohnlich ein. (ThurgauerZeitung)

description.hltext_display: 王大雷:2011结婚渴望留洋 能吓哭我的人未出生
description.content:
坐在康桥基地的房间内，王大雷下意识地用右手转动着左手无名指上的一枚戒指。满打满算，这个出生于1989年的申花门将，到今年不过才刚刚21岁，莫非，他已经做出了走进“围城”的决定？“应该是在明年吧。”
约好的时间，王大雷早到了5分钟。守时是一种美德，提前则是一种稀罕的美德。摄影师却还在路上。三个人被关在门外，王大雷索性席地而坐，开始啃香肠——他没有吃中饭，还带了碗泡面。
寒暄几句，同事刘晓艳赞他脚上那双皮鞋是好货色。他一听立刻眉飞色舞，说是自己四年前在意大利佛罗伦萨买的。当时一眼看中，价钱都没问就买了下来，至今仍不觉过时。可见也是个念旧之人，至少不喜新厌旧。姗姗来迟的摄影师把我们让进工作室，趁他布置器材设备的时候，王大雷喊着要吃泡面。帮他把那碗辣白菜面泡好递到手上，才吃下去一口却歪着头笑嘻嘻地说：“不对，肯定少放一包调料。”是男孩子的调皮劲儿，故意和你逗着玩。他边吃泡面边回答问题，说话是典型的北方人腔调，有点痞，但是很爽。聊到他微博上写的那些歌词，不少地方都提到了“地狱”，他究竟是怎么看待“地狱”这个概念？大雷眨巴眨巴眼睛说：“咱能不能不说这么深刻的玩意儿？”
这期的拍摄主题是圣诞节，要他来扮演圣诞老人。听说自己要打扮成那副模样，他立刻提出微弱的抗议，不过三言两语就被说服了。淘宝上买来的圣诞树，无论如何拼凑不成照片上的样子。他原本只在一旁咧着嘴乐呵呵地看热闹，看了一会凑近来说：“你们装得不对，应该把树枝分开来，像这样。”又亲自演示了一下，把原先并拢的树枝往外掰，并帮忙把装饰物仔仔细细地吊到圣诞树上去。看上去粗枝大叶的一个人，原来倒也细心。
轮到他穿着打扮成圣诞老人的时候，几个人手忙脚乱在一旁帮着拾掇。衣服腰身太大，别上几根大头针，一边叮嘱他，“大雷，不要乱动哦，小心被针头戳到。”王大雷的一张脸极具喜感，笑的时候眼睛眯成了一条缝。摄影师刚开始还以为他是不小心闭眼，重按了几次快门后再细看，发现人家笑起来眼睛就是这么小。有一张照片需要圣诞老人做甩气球的动作，手长脚长的大雷几次把气球甩出了相机的显示屏外。他头上的那顶帽子也永远戴得歪歪扭扭，几次被摄影师敦促戴正，但随后发现还是这位斜戴圣诞帽的圣诞老人更可爱些。
到了自选服装环节，他欢天喜地地从包里拿出自己那套很HIP-HOP风的装束来。用蓝边的雷朋配搭蓝色的T恤和蓝球鞋，反扣一顶帽子，又挂上了那条非常慑人心魄的链子。这立刻成为众人瞩目的焦点，他也十分得意，旁边的人打趣，这要是根真的钻石挂链就牛了。摄影师给他设计几个动作，他都觉得不中意，索性对人家说：“这样吧，我摆几个动作，你看看。”非常得心应手地拍完这组，又换上了自己偶像罗德曼的91号公牛队球衣背心，问他为什么喜欢罗德曼，他却给出一个很无厘头的答案——“因为他也不会投篮。”那么他大概是想表达人无完人，偶像也会有弱点的意思。
王大雷话不算多，基本上一个问题一句回答，言简意赅。唯独说到他喜欢的HIP-HOP，却很有心得。对我们这些对这种文化一窍不通且充满质疑的人，他耐着性子解释了一通。从为什么嘻哈歌手都喜欢骂脏话出发，“因为这种音乐的发源在美国的贫民区，那里的人们没有机会接受高等教育，而对被压迫的生活又有控诉的需要，脏话是一种愤怒的宣泄。”他说，嘻哈不仅仅是饶舌音乐，更是一种生活态度，甚至是一种信仰。
他也在积极寻找自己歌词的谱曲者，但是问他会不会在职业生涯结束后向乐坛发展，他却斩钉截铁地表示不会。他很明智，他不会把爱好和职业之间的那条分界线模糊掉。在被问到自己是在什么样的心境下构思出那些歌词时，他却不愿多谈。可以从他的回答里看出一种矛盾对立的思绪，一方面他有些不屑，另一方面他又渴望被认同。在拍摄的时候，他问了几遍，“还有没有什么要问的了？拍好照我可就走了啊。歌词什么的还有什么要问的吗？”他是有些矛盾的。
专题撰稿 本报记者 李冰 坐在康桥基地的房间内，王大雷下意识地用右手转动着左手无名指上的一枚戒指。满打满算，这个出生于1989年的申花门将，到今年不过才刚刚21岁，莫非，他已经做出了走进“围城”的决定？“应该是在明年吧。”对于记者的疑问，王大雷并没有回避，而是大方地承认，自己与那个“她”，已经做好了步入新的人生的准备：“一切都是顺其自然的，到了什么时候，就做什么时候的事情。”说这些话的时候，你很难把眼前这个看上去还有些稚嫩的王大雷，跟他嘴里说出的东西画上等号：“就像踢球一样，有些东西，急是急不来的……”
东方体育：刚刚过去的这个赛季，在你自己看来，应该如何评价呢？算得上成功吗？
王大雷：很难用一个词甚至一句话来形容。上半赛季，我一直打主力，当中有些比赛踢得还可以，但是有些比赛也踢得挺臭，只能说是正常发挥吧。打河南那场比赛受了伤，后来又伤过两次，比赛基本就没怎么打了。从我自己来讲，算不上很满意，但是也没有什么不满意的。关键是在比赛当中，我已经尽力了。
东方体育：申花队没能拿到联赛冠军，遗憾吗？毕竟在很长一段时间内，球队一直保持着夺冠的势头和希望。
王大雷：从情感上来讲，肯定会觉得遗憾，但是理智地来看，在整体实力上，我们跟鲁能泰山队，也确实有差距。别的不说，光是最后一场比赛，看看鲁能队替补席上坐着的，都是些什么队员？李金羽、王亮、王永珀、李雷雷，个个都是国字号的队员，而我们呢？本来实力就不如人家，有些人还有自己的想法，怎么打？
东方体育：2006年，你开始踢中超，到现在已经有五个年头了。很多人的感觉，就是王大雷曾经让他们看到了一个天才门将的影子，但这几年下来，你的进步，至少没有外界期待的那么大。
王大雷：我个人感觉最好的一段时间，就是我刚刚从意甲国际米兰队回到国内的时候，因为我感觉无论是技术方面的运用，还是个人的自信心，真的是比国内时高了不止一个档次。不过，这种感觉，是需要日常高水平的训练来维持的。刚开始的时候，我还可以按照国米教练教给我的那些东西去练，但时间长了，没有这个环境了，慢慢地也就松下来了。
东方体育：这些跟你成名太早、成功来得太容易有关系吗？你觉得现在还像刚刚踢上中超时那样，内心充满了斗志吗？
王大雷：在足球场上，我是一个对自己要求相当苛刻的人，我不能容忍自己出现任何失误。任何时候，我都对胜利充满了渴望，所以在比赛当中，不管我前面站的是谁，我该喊就喊，该骂就骂。我从来没觉得自己有多成功，我只是在比赛当中，尽了一个守门员应尽的职责，跟那些世界上最好的门将相比，我差得太远了。
东方体育：布拉泽维奇说，当你知道他要做国奥队主教练时，竟然吓得哭起来了，真有这回事吗？
王大雷：能把我吓哭的人，现在可能还没生出来吧，呵呵。可能老布当时就是拿我做个例子，为的就是证明他在训练当中有多严格，甚至会把球员训哭，然后就成了我被吓哭了吧。
东方体育：你很喜欢HIP-POP，并且在微博里发了不少自己的作品，所以有人也会担心，你会不会因为“不务正业”，影响了踢球。王大雷：就拿现在来说吧，一天24个小时，每天训练加起来三个小时，吃饭算一个小时，剩下20个小时里，我睡上12个小时的觉，但还是有8个小时，总不成你让我在这8个小时里一直抱着足球吧。其实写歌更多的是靠感觉，最快的时候，几分钟就出来了，慢的话半个小时也差不多了，根本就不会影响休息。
东方体育：2010年，对你来讲，一个很大的收获，应该就是再度入选了中国国奥队。王大雷：关键还是要看我在联赛当中的表现吧，这是最根本的，否则去了也打不上（主力），说不定过两天就被撵回来了。米卢说，态度决定一切，我觉得还应该加上实力和状态。没有实力做保证，或者有了实力却进入不了状态，就算你态度再好，一样没用。

description.hltext_display: Campioni&solidarietà, a Federer il primo match con Nadal
description.content:
sport > tennis
Il meglio del tennis sulla rotta Basilea-Madrid: andata e ritorno per due amichevoli tra due che riescono ad essere grandi amici nonostante la storica rivalità. Roger ha battuto Rafa nel primo incontro organizzato per raccogliere fondi per l'Africa
Grande festa a Basilea e spalti gremiti per il primo match esibizione Nadal-Federer (Getty)
Parole Chiave
roger federer rafa nadal 22-12-2010 sport tennis
Il sito di Roger Federer Il sito di Rafa Nadal
Perchè va amato Nadal, l'incubo freudiano di Federer Chi ama il Tennis ama Federer, il Re della racchetta Tutti gli articoli sul Tennis
di Ghilda Pensante
Il meglio del tennis sulla rotta Basilea-Madrid: andata e ritorno per due amichevoli tra due che riescono ad essere grandi amici nonostante la storica rivalità. Federer e Nadal hanno messo in piedi due sfide nel giro di 24 ore, con un unico obiettivo: raccogliere fondi per l'infanzia. Ad accomunarli però è anche e soprattutto quell'immenso talento che trasforma persino un incontro benefico in un confronto emozionante. Amici sì, ma nessuno dei due ci sta a perdere.
A meno di un mese dalla finale di Londra che l'ha incoronato re di fine stagione, sebbene in testa al ranking resti il rivale, Federer ha vinto ancora contro Nadal, questa volta davanti al pubblico amico di Zurigo. Spalti pieni e alcuni ospiti d'onore, compresi l'olimpionica Lindsey Vonn, il campione del mondo di Formula Uno Sebastian Vettel, per assistere al Match per l'Africa, che l'associazione dello svizzero organizza ogni anno con lo scopo di aiutare i bambini di Tanzania, Etiopia, Zimbabwe, Malawi e Sudafrica.
Il numero uno della classifica si è preso il primo set breakkando Federer nel nono gioco e chiudendo 6-4, poi ha perso il servizio in apertura del secondo e da lì il fenomeno di Basilea ha concesso pochissimo, aggiudicandosi gli altri due parziali con un doppio 6-3. La rivincita per Nadal però può arrivare già questa sera, quando dal cemento elvetico si passerà alla terra di Madrid per sostenere la fondazione di Rafa, che sostiene progetti in favore di bambini svantaggiati e con disabilità. Nell'ultima occasione sul rosso, sette mesi fa proprio nella capitale spagnola, a imporsi è stato Nadal: si tratta di un'amichevole, certo, ma nessuno dei due se ne sarà dimenticato.

description.hltext_display: The newly formed kindergarten Woodmont Daisy Troop 4537 is off to a great start. The girls earned their Blue Daisy Center patch in their first meeting by learning the Girl Scout Promise. ...
description.content:
The newly formed kindergarten Woodmont Daisy Troop 4537 is off to a great start. The girls earned their Blue Daisy Center patch in their first meeting by learning the Girl Scout Promise. During the troop's second meeting, the girls visited Conklin Farm U-Pick in Montville, where they went on hay rides and picked pumpkins. In addition, they learned about all the various types of pumpkins and how they grow. At their November meeting, the girls earned their light green petal, Considerate and Caring. Each girl donated and decorated their personal bag for the Kiwanis food pantry in Montville.
PHOTO COURTESY OF LORI GALLUCCI

description.hltext_display: VKI: Luftfrachtführer haftet bei verlorenem Fluggepäck
description.content: Utl.: Musterprozess klärt Ersatzansprüche von Passagieren nach dem Montrealer Übereinkommen =Wien (OTS/VKI) - Der (VKI) gewinnt einen Musterprozess gegen Last Minute Restplatzreisen mit Sitz in Baden-Baden. Bei diesem Prozess wurde im Auftrag des Konsumentenschutzministeriums auf Schadenersatz wegen Verlust des Fluggepäcks geklagt. Dabei zeigte ein Sachverständigen-Gutachten klar auf, wie der Verlust von Gebrauchsgegenständen zu bewerten ist. Hatte man seitens des Unternehmens zunächst versucht, die Reisende mit 68 Euro abzuspeisen, bekommt die Geschädigte nun - nach zwei Jahren Prozess - immerhin 1.074 Euro zugesprochen. Das Urteil ist nicht rechtskräftig. Im Sommer 2008 hatte die Konsumentin bei Last Minute Restplatzreisen eine Flugreise von Wien nach Sardinien gebucht. Ausführendes Luftfahrtunternehmen war Meridiana. In einer Sporttasche hatte die Konsumentin die typischen Utensilien: Kleidung, Kosmetika, elektronische Geräte, Bücher. Die Tasche wurde als Gepäck aufgegeben. Bei der Ankunft in Sardinien war die Tasche verschwunden. Die Konsumentin meldete den Verlust am zuständigen Schalter und wartete den gesamten Urlaub darauf, dass sich die Tasche noch finden würde. Diese blieb allerdings verschwunden. Sie verlangte Schadenersatz und bekam - ein halbes Jahr und zahlreiche Briefe und Telefonate später - lediglich 68 Euro ersetzt. Die Konsumentin trat daraufhin ihre Ansprüche dem VKI ab, der sowohl den Reiseveranstalter als auch die Fluglinie auf Schadenersatz klagte. Gegen die Fluglinie erging ein Versäumungsurteil. Der Veranstalter argumentierte im Prozess insbesondere damit, dass das gesamte Gepäck nicht neuwertig gewesen sei und der Verkehrswert sich daher in etwa am Wert von eBay-Versteigerungen messen lassen müsse. Dem traten Sachverständige und Richterin entgegen: Wenn eine Sache keinen Verkehrswert habe, dann sei der Wiederbeschaffungswert heranzuziehen. Die geringfügigen Kaufpreise auf eBay waren daher nicht Maßstab. Der Luftfrachtführer, in diesem Fall der Reiseveranstalter, haftet bei Verlust des Fluggepäcks nach dem Montrealer Übereinkommen - allerdings nur bis zu einem Höchstbetrag von 1.142 Euro. Dieser Betrag wird an dem Tag, an dem das Urteil gefällt wird, umgerechnet. Unter Berücksichtigung der erhaltenen 68 Euro wurden der Konsumentin daher 1.074 Euro zugesprochen. "Es ist ein typisches Ärgernis für Fluggäste, dass Fluglinien im Fall des Verlustes von Reisegepäck versuchen, sich durch allerlei Argumente und Kulanzangebote aus der Haftung zu stehlen. Das Verfahren zeigt, dass man vor Gericht in der Regel weit mehr durchsetzen kann, als einem zuvor angeboten wird", sagt Dr. Peter Kolba, Leiter des Bereiches Recht im VKI. "Die Unternehmen wissen genau, dass sich Konsumenten ohne Rechtsschutzversicherung eine Rechtsdurchsetzung nie leisten könnten. So betrug im vorliegenden Fall das Kostenrisiko etwa rund das Dreifache des Streitwertes. Hier muss man zu effizienteren Formen der Rechtsdurchsetzung finden - sonst bestehen die Fluggastrechte zwar auf dem Papier, nicht aber in der Praxis." Der Volltext des Urteils ist auf www.verbraucherrecht.at zugänglich. Rückfragehinweis: Dr. Peter Kolba, Leiter Bereich Recht Tel.: 01 / 58877 - 320 *** OTS-ORIGINALTEXT PRESSEAUSSENDUNG UNTER AUSSCHLIESSLICHER INHALTLICHER VERANTWORTUNG DES AUSSENDERS - WWW.OTS.AT *** OTS0031 2010-12-22/09:37 220937 Dez 10 NKI0001 0455

description.hltext_display: Lady Gaga shoppaili pylly paljaana
description.content:
Lady Gaga tuntuu tuumivan, että asuksi ostosreissulle käyvät pelkät niukat alusvaatteet, takki ja verkkosukkahousut.
Lady Gaga tunnetaan varsin omintakeisesta tyylistään, mutta ostosreissulla Pariisissa nähty asu oli jopa tältä tähdeltä melkoinen näytös. 24-vuotias poppari "pukeutui" Pariisin pakkasiin ihonvärisiin alusvaatteisiin, mustaan PVC-takkiin ja verkkosukkahousuihin. Tyylin viimeistelivät fetissihenkiset kaulapanta ja saappaat sekä mustat Chanelin aurinkolasit, kertoo Daily Mail.
Kuka tämän leidin takana kävelikään pääsi ihailemaan laulajattaren paljaita pakaroita verkkosukkahousujen alta. Alushousutkin kun olivat niukinta mahdollista mallia.
Lady Gagan Ranskan-reissu venyi odotettua pidemmäksi säiden herrojen puututtua peliin. Runsas lumentulo lykkäsi sunnuntaille sovittua konsertointia tiistaille.

description.hltext_display: "Bravura Indômita", o Velho Oeste dos irmãos Coen
description.content:
Fernando Mexía.
Los Angeles (EUA), 22 dez (EFE).- Livro e filme de sucesso, "Bravura Indômita" se reinventa mais de 40 anos depois pelo olhar dos irmãos Coen, que estreiam no Velho Oeste com uma história de vingança, valentões rápidos no gatilho e, como não, humor negro.
Baseado no relato publicado por Charles Portis em 1968, o filme que estreia nesta quarta-feira nos Estados Unidos gira em torno da figura de uma corajosa adolescente de 14 anos, Mattie Ross (Hailee Steinfeld), e seu empenho em se vingar de Tom Chaney (Josh Brolin), o homem que matou seu pai.
Na caçada de Mattie, a garota é acompanhada - com má vontade - por dois pistoleiros agentes da lei e mercenários: o bêbado implacável com seu característico tapa-olho Rooster Cogburn (Jeff Bridges) e o "Texas Ranger" (um dos serviços de segurança do Texas) obstinado e charlatão LaBeouf (Matt Damon).
"Nós sempre quisemos fazer um 'western'", revelou Ethan Coen à Agência Efe em entrevista concedida em Los Angeles junto com o irmão Joel, na qual ambos insistiram que o filme tem mais a ver com o "entusiasmo" pela obra de Portis do que com uma tentativa de fazer uma homenagem ao gênero "bang bang".
"A gente leu o livro pela primeira vez há muito tempo", lembrou Joel, para revelar que apenas há pouco tempo, após seu filho ter tido contato com a obra, que a dupla começou a imaginar que daria "um grande filme".
Quem chegou à mesma conclusão no final dos anos 1960 foi o produtor Hal B. Wallis ("O Falcão Maltês", 1941 e "Casablanca", 1942) e o diretor Henry Hathaway ("A Conquista do Oeste", 1962) que se encarregaram de passar a história do papel para as telas pela primeira vez.
"Bravura Indômita" estreou em 1969 nos cinemas dos EUA com grande sucesso de público e garantiu ao carismático John Wayne o único Oscar de sua carreira, por sua interpretação de Cogburn.
"Nós sabíamos que já tinha sido feito um filme antes e já tínhamos assistido, mas fazia muito tempo e tínhamos uma lembrança muito vaga do filme", revelou Joel.
A ideia de um "remake" não passou pela cabeça dos Coen, que recorreram diretamente ao material de Portis para a elaboração do roteiro, em vez de utilizarem a versão feita por Hathaway no filme de 1969.
A fidelidade à obra original ficou especialmente visível nos diálogos, extraídos quase diretamente do romance e carregados de aspereza. Além disso, com um sotaque que exige um esforço inicial do espectador, as falas foram definidas pelo ator Barry Pepper, um dos bandidos do filme, como "Shakespeare à americana".
Como já é de praxe nas produções dos Coen, violência, drama e comédia se intercalam também na ação de "Bravura Indômita" conferindo diferentes dimensões aos personagens, entre os quais se destaca o Cogburn de um convincente Bridges.
"Foi a primeira pessoa na qual pensamos para o papel", relatou Ethan, que já tinha dirigido o ator em "O Grande Lebowski" (1998).
"Jeff Bridges é versátil e tinha o perfil adequado porque pode ser muito engraçado e dramático ao mesmo tempo", acrescentou Joel.
O mais difícil foi encontrar a atriz que para viver Mattie. Após meses de busca pelos EUA e milhares de testes, os Coen escolheram a desconhecida Hailee Steinfeld, que com 13 anos foi capaz interpretar a protagonista sem se amedrontar.
"Nós a encontramos pouco antes de começar rodar, tivemos muita sorte", disse Ethan, para quem "Bravura Indômita" tem potencial "para atingir um público maior" do que qualquer um dos filmes que fizeram até o momento.
"Achamos que pode atrair famílias", explicou Ethan, um palpite que pode ser confirmado pela classificação etária do filme, 13 anos, um grau inferior ao que normalmente é imposto pela Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA, na sigla em inglês, o órgão regulador americano) às produções dos Coen, sempre restritas ao público adulto.
Esse foi o caso de "Um Homem Sério" (2009), "Onde os fracos não têm vez" (2007) e "Fargo" (2004), filmes candidatos ao Oscar, ao qual "Bravura Indômita" é favorito ao lado de "A Rede Social", "O Discurso do Rei" e "O Vencedor", apesar de ter ficado de fora do Globo de Ouro.
"Sempre me pareceu estranho que antes da estreia já estejam dizendo quanto dinheiro e quantos prêmios o filme vai ganhar", declarou Joel, que não esconde que as expectativas são bastante altas. EFE

description.hltext_display: Jedna služebna na svátky osiří
description.content:
Rychnovsko - Do práce od pátku do neděle nepůjdou strážníci v Týništi nad Orlicí. Policisté a hasiči nezbytný pořádek zajistí.
Autor:
reklama
Diskutovat (0) dnes 7:33
Ilustrační foto
Autor: Radek Pavlík
Na sváteční rozjímání v blízkosti svých známých budou muset zapomenout hasiči a policisté, kteří o vánočních svátcích půjdou do služby. I během nich je totiž potřeba zajistit bezpečnost a být nepřetržitě v pohotovosti, kdyby se někde něco stalo.
Proto také u rychnovské policie budou na příslušných obvodních odděleních „v pozoru“ členové dopravní i pořádkové služby. „Počty sloužících policistů z taktických a strategických důvodů nesdělujeme, ale vše bude pokryté tak, aby byl zajištěn pořádek. Provoz bude nepřetržitý, i ti, kteří nemusí do práce, budou v pohotovosti. Že jsou svátky, neznamená, že policie má volno,“ uvedla rychnovská policejní mluvčí Alena Kacálková.
Že by třeba na rychnovské služebně zavládlo veselí, si nemyslí. „Žádná výzdoba prakticky není. Ale je možné, že někteří přinesou cukroví od manželek. Přece jenom slouží dlouho, tak si zpříjemní atmosféru, Vánoce pochopitelně vnímají,“ doplnila mluvčí.
Také strážníci v Dobrušce a v Kostelci nad Orlicí se během Vánoc budou podílet na zajištění pořádku ve svých městech. „Na noční i denní služby bude dvoučlenná hlídka, ve spojení se státní policií budeme ve čtyřech, pokud zrovna někdo nebude v horách. Spolupracujeme i se záchrannou službou a s hasiči, takže to snad zvládneme. Zajistíme tak nepřetržitý provoz,“ informoval velitel dobrušské městské policie Luboš Adamec.
„Na Štědrý den bude dopoledne dvoučlenná hlídka, odpoledne je klidnější, takže ve službě zůstane jeden. Na noc budou zase dva stejně jako o víkendu. U nás totiž naštěstí svátky bývají klidnější, i Silvestr,“ řekl šéf kosteleckých strážníků Petr Černohorský.
Nohy na stolech však na dobrušské ani na kostelecké služebně nečekejte. „Žádná extra atmosféra se u nás nedrží. Pokud někdo donese třeba cukroví, tak ovšem není problém posedět chvíli u kafe. Ale jsme tu pro lidi, takže řešíme každou podanou stížnost,“ pravil Černohorský. „Určitě si sami něco přinesou, stromek a cukroví zajistíme. Doufáme, že svátky budou klidnější,“ připojil Adamec.
Zcela jiná situace však nastane pro strážníky v Týništi nad Orlicí, o svátcích totiž do práce nepůjdou. „Třiadvacátého o půlnoci zavřeme služebnu a vrátíme se až v pondělí do standardní služby. Stále tu bude státní policie, my jsme jakoby navíc. Nějaké posezení s občerstvením uděláme po Novém roce, až se vše zklidní,“ informoval velitel týnišťské městské policie Martin Štěpánek.
V případě potřeby budou v permanenci také rychnovští hasiči. „Každoročně zajišťujeme směny a výjezdy skupin i o svátcích. Někteří sice čerpají dovolené, chtějí si totiž Vánoce užít doma, když mají možnost, ale máme rozpis, díky kterému je takový početní stav, abychom byli schopni zajistit dva organizované výjezdy. Je na to vyhláška, takovou situaci máme víckrát do roka,“ přiblížil velitel stanice Josef Tošovský.
Pokud hasičům nic nepokazí případná nutnost výjezdu, Vánoce by mohli strávit prakticky idylicky. „Na stanici máme malý strom, sloužící směna bude mít i štědrovečerní večeři. Mělo by jít o rybu zřejmě více druhů. Připraven bude slavnostní stůl, večeře bude společná, aby se navodila ta správná atmosféra.
Ovšem v případě potřeby budou členové sboru schopni do zákonem daných dvou minut vyjet,“ ujistil Tošovský.

description.hltext_display: Nyhet: Mario Sports Mix med dato
description.content:
Senest i november meldte vi at Mario Sports Mix hadde fått dato, og den gang ble det sagt at spillet kom til å havne i butikkene den 28. januar. Det viser seg å være feilaktig informasjon, da sportsspillet vil bli lansert den 4. februar i stedet.
Square Enix står bak Marios sportseventyr, og de lar oss spille både hockey, basketball, volleyball og stikkball.

description.hltext_display: 饥渴女袭吻 草食男腿软 网民叹为观止
Rama Yade en voie d'être nommée ambassadrice à l'Unesco
description.content:
Rama Yade le 30 octobre 2010 à Saint-Malo
L'ex-secrétaire d'Etat Rama Yade devrait être nommée mercredi en Conseil des ministres ambassadrice, déléguée permanente de la France auprès de l'Unesco en remplacement de Catherine Colonna, a-t-on appris de source proche du dossier, confirmant une information de RTL.
Figurant parmi les personnalités les plus populaires en France, Rama Yade, 34 ans, devrait être nommée ambassadrice auprès de l'Organisation des Nations unies pour l'éducation, la science et la culture, dont le siège est à Paris.
Ex porte-parole de l'Elysée sous Jacques Chirac, ex-ministre de Affaires européennes, Catherine Colonna occupait cette fonction depuis 2008.
Rama Yade a été secrétaire d'Etat aux droits de l'Homme (2007-2009) puis secrétaire d'Etat aux Sports (2009-2010). Après avoir fait ses premières armes à l'UMP, poussée par Nicolas Sarkozy, elle a rejoint récemment Jean-Louis Borloo au parti radical.
De la visite de Kadhafi à sa critique -tardive- du discours de Dakar, en passant par ses caprices électoraux, la jeune femme, qui a eu 34 ans en décembre, a incarné au gouvernement l'anti-conformisme plus que la "diversité", aux Droits de l'homme puis aux Sports.
Née à Dakar d'un couple d'enseignants proche de Senghor, elle est arrivée en France à onze ans. Elle est diplômée de Sciences po, administratrice du Sénat, avant d'apparaître pour la première fois sous les feux des projecteurs le jour de l'investiture de Nicolas Sarkozy comme candidat UMP à l'élection présidentielle en janvier 2007.
Battue aux municipales à Colombes en 2008, Rama Yade a tenu tête à deux reprises au chef de l'Etat et à l'UMP en refusant de se présenter aux Européennes en 2009, puis en choisissant de se présenter dans les Hauts-de-Seine et non dans le Val-d'Oise aux régionales de 2010.

description.hltext_display: St George gives first home owners boost
description.content:
ST GEORGE Bank will recognise rental payments as evidence of genuine savings, providing a much needed boost for first home buyers.
Mortgage broker Loan Market today welcomed the bank’s move, saying it could be a major boost to the home finance industry.
Loan Market chief operating officer Dean Rushton said St George will accept rent as a form of savings for a home deposit provided there is evidence of a minimum of 12 months’ continuous, satisfactory rental history and the property is leased through a licensed property manager.
The move, however, does not change St George’s requirements for a home deposit
“This is a significant breakthrough for first homebuyers and a move which could be a major boost to the home finance industry,” Mr Rushton said.
“Higher interest rates, tougher lending conditions and the end of the boosted federal government grant at the end of last year have driven first time buyers out of the market.
Start of sidebar. Skip to end of sidebar.
End of sidebar. Return to start of sidebar.
“Another major restriction for them has been the difficulty in saving a deposit for a home loan, particularly in this economic climate with people having to cope with massive cost of living increases including rental payments.
“Australian lenders require a percentage of the purchase price - normally five per cent minimum - to be saved for all loans but it is extremely difficult for people paying the exorbitant rents customary these days to save money.
“But if rental payments were taken into consideration as a factor in assessing genuine savings that would enable many people to pursue the dream of home ownership.
“St George has now moved to accept rental history as a form of genuine savings and they should be applauded for this decision as it will enable a lot more people to realise the great Australian dream of home ownership.
“This is a major step forward which will also boost activity in the struggling home finance sector and we expect other lenders to follow suit.”

event_or_fact.property: St George will accept rent as a form of savings for a home deposit provided there is evidence of a minimum of 12 months? continuous, satisfactory rental history and the property is leased through a licensed property manager

description.hltext_display: Dubai World arm cuts stake in Australia for $1.5B
description.author: ADAM SCHRECK
description.content:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates � DP World, the port management arm of indebted state conglomerate Dubai World, sold the bulk of its Australian businesses to a Citi investment fund Wednesday for $1.5 billion.
Unloading the stake will help the sea cargo handler pay down debt and retain a foothold in Australia while it focuses on emerging markets that have fueled much of its growth.
Under the terms of the deal, DP World will keep a 25 percent stake and continue to manage the ports in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide and Fremantle.
It is selling the remaining 75 percent in the Australian operations to Citi Infrastructure Investors, a private equity division of the New York-based bank.
DP World CEO Mohammed Sharaf told reporters it was not part of a broader effort to dismantle the company's globe-stretching operations.
"We're not in a selling spree out there. We're talking about bringing in strategic partners," he said. "They approached us."
DP World is one of Dubai's more profitable state-linked companies. It ranks as the world's fourth largest port operator, with business at 50 cargo terminals on six continents, including the Mideast's largest in Dubai.
It pulled in $219.2 million in profit in the first half of this year.
The company is part of the city-state's struggling Dubai World conglomerate, but was exempted from its parent's $24.9 billion debt restructuring effort.
DP World said it expects to retain its existing management and staff in Australia. It employs about 2,100 people throughout the country, according to a corporate website.
The $1.5 billion it expects to generate includes the repayment of debts held by the Australian division.
DP World has had a presence in Australia since 2005, when it took over operations in Adelaide following the acquisition of U.S. railroad operator CSX Corp.'s international port business.
It gained operational control of the other four ports through its buyout of Britain's Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Co. the following year.
The agreements that give DP World the right to manage the five ports run for an average of more than two decades, following recent deals to renew its concessions at Adelaide, Brisbane and Sydney, according to the company.
Yuvraj Narayan, DP World's chief financial officer, said all proceeds from the Citi sale will go toward paying down the company's debt.
Executives expect the deal to close toward the end of the first quarter next year.

event_or_fact.property: it was not part of a broader effort to dismantle the company's globe-stretching operations
We're not in a selling spree out there.; We're talking about bringing in strategic partners; They approached us.
all proceeds from the Citi sale will go toward paying down the company's debt

description.hltext_display: Marijuana Mutiny: Montana Judge Can't Find Unbiased Jury For Pot Case
description.author: Carly Schwartz
description.content:
A marijuana mutiny? According to a prosecutor in Missoula County, Mont., potential jurors made it clear they wouldn't convict anyone for possessing a few buds of pot. District Judge Dusty Deschamps found it impossible to seat a jury, and decided to work out a plea bargain for the man in question, Touray Cornell, instead.
The Missoulian reports : "I thought, 'Geez, I don't know if we can seat a jury,' " said Deschamps, who called a recess. And he didn't.
During the recess, Paul and defense attorney Martin Elison worked out a plea agreement. That was on Thursday.
On Friday, Cornell entered an Alford plea, in which he didn't admit guilt. He briefly held his infant daughter in his manacled hands, and walked smiling out of the courtroom.
"Public opinion, as revealed by the reaction of a substantial portion of the members of the jury called to try the charges on Dec. 16, 2010, is not supportive of the state's marijuana law and appeared to prevent any conviction from being obtained simply because an unbiased jury did not appear available under any circumstances," according to the plea memorandum filed by his attorney.
"A mutiny," said Paul.
"Bizarre," the defense attorney called it.
In his nearly 30 years as a prosecutor and judge, Deschamps said he's never seen anything like it.
Authorities reportedly worry that Cornell's situation will set a precedent for prosecuting future drug cases in Montana.

event_or_fact.property: Geez, I don't know if we can seat a jury
he's never seen anything like it

description.hltext_display: 意大利足坛一代传奇人物 “烟斗教练”与世长辞
description.author: sohu.com
description.content:
曾率领意大利队夺得1982年世界杯赛的“烟斗教练”贝阿尔佐特昨天在米兰去世。贝阿尔佐特生前成功地将进攻融入死气沉沉的意大利式防守之中，并使意大利足球在时隔44年后再次登上世界之巅。
据悉，贝阿尔佐特近年来一直患病，昨天去世后，意大利全国从总理贝卢斯科尼到足坛人士，纷纷表示哀悼。1982年世界杯赛最佳射手罗西说：“贝阿尔佐特就像我的父亲，没有他绝没有我今天的荣耀。”罗西当年因为参与赌球被禁赛两年，世界杯赛前禁赛期满，贝阿尔佐特慧眼识人，力排众议，将两年没有比赛的罗西选入队中，不料罗西最终一鸣惊人，帮助意大利队捧杯。
现任意大利主帅普兰蒂尼说，贝阿尔佐特为所有意大利队主教练树立了一个榜样，他的执教和治队理念值得所有继任者效仿。2006年意大利世界杯冠军队主教练里皮说：“当年是贝阿尔佐特首次选我进入意大利23岁以下青年队，我担任意大利队主教练后曾向他求教。”
上世纪八十年代，意大利足球以混凝土式防守著称于世，不过进攻大为逊色。贝阿尔佐特将进攻融入意大利足球，在1982年世界杯赛中，“蓝色军团”连续战胜 1978年世界杯赛冠军阿根廷、夺魁大热门巴西、1974年世界杯赛冠军德国等劲旅，最终捧杯。这是意大利队继1934年和1938年蝉联世界杯赛冠军后，第三次问鼎世界杯，意大利足球进入第二春。贝阿尔佐特因为现场指挥比赛时常常含着烟斗，有“烟斗教练”之称。
贝阿尔佐特球员时代是一名中后卫，曾效力国际米兰、卡塔尼亚、都灵，仅代表意大利队出场过1次。退役后他担任意大利一支丙级队主教练，不过随后进入意大利足协教练班子，先是出任23岁以下青年队主教练，1975年升任意大利队主教练，率队参加了1978年、1982年、1986年3届世界杯赛。贝阿尔佐特在意大利队主教练岗位干了11年，共率队征战104场，目前尚未有其他意大利队主帅接近这个纪录。

description.hltext_display: Schiavi: hay “falta de colaboración” de Ciudad
description.content:
La Secretaria de Transporte de la Nación, que encabeza Juan Pablo Schiavi, informó hoy al juez Federal Ariel Lijo que debió abortarse el operativo destinado a cercar y realizar un relevamiento de los terrenos ferroviarios ocupados en la zona de Retiro "debido a la falta de colaboración" por parte del gobierno porteño y a que "no estaban dadas las condiciones para dar estricto cumplimiento a la orden judicial".
Ayer el juez Ariel Lijo del juzgado nacional en lo Criminal y Correccional Federal número 4, había solicitado al Ministerio de Ambiente y Espacio Público de la Ciudad, al Ministerio de Seguridad de la Nación y a la Secretaría de Transporte de la Nación "realizar un amplio relevamiento del sector intrusado", el predio ferroviario lindero a la denominada Calle 14 de Retiro.
Según informó la Secretaría de Transporte en un comunicado, Lijo solicitó "adoptar mecanismos a los efectos de cercar la zona" e "impedir el ingreso de materiales para la construcción de viviendas".
En la nota enviada por Schiavi al Juez Lijo, se señala que esta mañana a las 9 asistieron al lugar autoridades del Ministerio de Seguridad de la Nación y el Secretario de Transporte, mientras que el Gobierno porteño "no envió ningún funcionario de rango y responsabilidad para llevar adelante el operativo".
En su escrito, el funcionario hizo constar además que el personal y equipo enviado por el Ministerio de Ambiente y Espacio Público "era insuficiente y carecía de idoneidad como para cumplimentar los compromisos asumidos por sus autoridades, consistentes en saturar el área".
A su vez, se advirtió la "no asistencia de personal del Programa Buenos Aires Presente, dependiente también del Gobierno de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, quienes se ocuparían de las tareas de contención y asistencia social a vecinos de la Ciudad, ocupantes del predio en cuestión".
"Debido a la falta de colaboración por parte de las autoridades de la Ciudad, y a que no estaban dadas las condiciones para dar estricto cumplimiento a la orden judicial, por ausencias y omisiones ajenas a las Autoridades Nacionales, y ante la posible derivación de situaciones que pudieren comprometer la integridad física de los ocupantes del predio, no hubo otra alternativa que cancelar el operativo acordado", agregó Schiavi en el escrito enviado al Juez.
Asimismo alertó al juzgado respecto de "hechos o acciones que pudieran ser ocasionados en el predio en cuestión, como así también en las instalaciones bajo jurisdicción de esta Secretaria en la zona, principalmente, la Terminal de Ómnibus de Retiro", que por inicio de la temporada estival su nivel de operación se torna "excepcionalmente alto".
Por último, el funcionario destacó "los máximos esfuerzos" del gobierno nacional a "fin de colaborar en el cumplimento de la orden judicial, ello en el estricto marco legal que delimita sus respectivas competencias".

description.hltext_display: 'Spider-Man' stunt goes awry; is show in peril?
description.content:
Tom Zahner, of Cologne, Germany, leaves the Spider Man box office after purchasing tickets, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in New York. The troubled Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" was plagued by its fourth accident since it began previews last month when a performer doing an aerial stunt fell about 30 feet, fire officials said.
AP
In this cell phone photo taken on Dec. 20, 2010 and provided by OnLocationVacations.com, actor Christopher Tierney is taken on a stretcher to an ambulance after he fell about 30 feet while performing an aerial stunt in the Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" in New York. (AP Photo/OnLocationVacations.com, John Matthews) NO SALES; MANDATORY CREDIT.
AP Photo
A television news van is parked in front of Foxwoods Theatre, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in New York. The troubled Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" was plagued by its fourth accident since it began previews last month when a performer doing an aerial stunt fell about 30 feet, fire officials said.
AP Photo
Carolyn Locke, of Ashland, Mass., speaks to reporters in front of Foxwoods Theatre, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in New York. The troubled Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" was plagued by its fourth accident since it began previews last month when a performer doing an aerial stunt fell about 30 feet, fire officials said.
AP
In this Dec. 20, 2010 image taken from video obtained by Associated Press Television News, actor Christopher Tierney falls during an aerial stunt in the Broadway production of "Spider-Man: Turn off the Dark" at the Foxwoods Theatre in New York. Tierney fell 30 feet and was taken to Bellevue Hospital with minor injuries. (AP Photo/APTN) NO SALES
AP Photo
FILE - An Oct. 5, 2010 file photo shows a banner covering the front of the Foxwoods Theater on 42nd street in New York for the play Spider-Man: Turn off the Dark. A 31-year-old actor on the set of the Broadway musical "Spider-Man, Turn Off the Dark" fell about 30 feet during a performance and was taken to a hospital, fire officials said Monday Dec. 20, 2010.
AP Photo
FILE - In this Sept. 10, 2010 file photo, Julie Taymor, director of the musical "Spider-Man Turn Off The Dark," is photographed in New York after appearing on ABC's "Good Morning America." The troubled Broadway show was plagued by its fourth accident Monday, Dec 20, 2010, when an actor performing an aerial stunt fell about 30 feet. Firefighters were called to the Foxwoods Theatre after the 31-year-old actor fell near the end of the latest preview performance. He was taken to Bellevue Hospital with minor injuries, police said.
ADDITIONAL DETAILS
Similar stories: Broadway might need a superhero to save the new Spider-Man musical. "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark," the most expensive production in Broadway history, suffered its fourth accident in a month when a stuntman playing the web-slinger fell about 30 feet into a stage pit during a preview Monday night. The safety tether that clips to his back failed to prevent the spill.
The performer, Christopher W. Tierney, was wheeled out of the Foxwoods Theatre on a stretcher, still in his costume, and taken by ambulance to Bellevue Hospital with minor injuries. He suffered broken ribs and internal bleeding, said a castmate, who spoke on condition of anonymity because the person was not authorized to speak publicly about the musical.
An uncle in Florida, Michael Tierney, said when reached by phone Tuesday night that he had spoken with his nephew a few hours ago. "He sounded pretty good," Tierney said, adding that his nephew was still at the hospital when he spoke with him.
Musical 'Spider-Man' on Broadway delayed again
Producers have once again delayed the opening of the troubled new Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark," the fourth major delay in performances this year for the much-mocked show.
The official opening was pushed back 27 days, from Jan. 11 to Feb. 7, because a key actor has missed several previews due to injury and after producers decided that the creative team needs to work out more kinks before allowing critics to weigh in.
"Due to some unforeseeable setbacks, most notably the injury of a principal cast member, it has become clear that we need to give the team more time to fully execute their vision," lead producer Michael Cohl said in a statement Friday. "I have no intention of cutting a single corner in getting to the finish line."
Musical 'Spider-Man' on Broadway delayed again
Opening night for the troubled new Broadway musical "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" has been delayed yet again.
Producers on Friday pushed the official opening back 27 days, from Jan. 11 to Feb. 7, deciding the creative team needs to work out more kinks before allowing critics to weigh in. It was the fourth major delay in performances this year.
"Due to some unforeseeable setbacks, most notably the injury of a principal cast member, it has become clear that we need to give the team more time to fully execute their vision," lead producer Michael Cohl said in a statement. "I have no intention of cutting a single corner in getting to the finish line."
After a stint in rehab for depression and time off, Kirsten Dunst returns in 'All Good Things'
LOS ANGELES - Kirsten Dunst was losing it, and Hollywood was starting to worry. During production of 2008's "How to Lose Friends & Alienate People," she and her boyfriend broke up, and director Robert Weide saw "a girl who was just right on the edge, emotionally feeling wiped out and devastated."
Perhaps it was inevitable. After all, she'd been acting for more than two decades - and was only in her mid-twenties. She had started performing in commercials when she was 4. Her earnings were set aside for college, but she never went - those plans were derailed when, at 12, her career took off after a Golden Globe-nominated turn opposite Brad Pitt in "Interview With the Vampire."
She went on to become Mary Jane Watson in three Spider-Man films that took in more than $2.5 billion at the box office worldwide. But aside from that, the quintessential girl-next-door seemed to be floundering. Tabloids presented her as an out-of-control party girl, publishing photos of her bleary-eyed and bra-less, while
NFL Preview - Indianapolis (6-6) at Tennessee (5-7)
There was a point in this 2010 season where the Indianapolis Colts and Tennessee Titans appeared to be the clear-cut top two contenders for the AFC South crown. But when the time comes for these divisional foes to face one another Thursday at Nashville's LP Field, both find themselves merely trying to stay alive in the playoff chase.
The Colts and Titans each spent a period in sole possession of first place in the AFC South at midseason, before the teams fell victim to unexpected and prolonged slumps that are still ongoing. Indianapolis was 6-3 and owned a one- game advantage atop the standings in mid-November, but has since lost three straight times. Tennessee held a half-game lead in the division race at 5-2 through Week 7, but hasn't prevailed in five subsequent outings as a wave of turmoil has engulfed the normally-stable franchise.
As it stands now, Thursday's participants are both looking up at the surprising Jacksonville in the pecking order, with the 7-5 Jaguars registering their fourth win in
NEW YORK — The fate of Broadway's most expensive accident-prone musical is in limbo as producers try to rejigger their high-flying stunts in time to satisfy safety investigators and reopen.
Producers canceled a Wednesday matinee performance of "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" after Monday evening's 30-foot plunge of a Spider-Man stunt double into a stage pit.
State investigators weren't sure whether the equipment, the rigging or the performer caused the fourth accident in the troubled show. Actors' Equity Association called it human error, but Leo Rosales, a spokesman for the state Department of Labor, said the cause was under investigation.
Rosales said the show's producers would present the new safety protocols on Wednesday. If the measures are inadequate, he said, the state will not let the show perform the complicated aerial maneuvers.
"If it takes longer, it will need to take longer," he said of the show's timing. "We need to be satisfied."
The musical, which started previews a month ago without benefit of an out-of-town tryout, could be put in jeopardy if certain aerial actions aren't allowed; it would lose some of its razzle-dazzle.
Monday's performance of "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark," the most expensive production in Broadway history, ended just minutes before its curtain when Christopher W. Tierney, a stuntman playing the superhero, fell into the stage pit. The safety tether that clips to his back failed to prevent the spill.
Tierney was wheeled out of the Foxwoods Theatre on a stretcher, still in his costume, and taken by ambulance to Bellevue Hospital with minor injuries. An uncle in Florida, Michael Tierney, said Tuesday that he spoke with his nephew by phone.
"He sounded pretty good," Tierney said, adding that when he spoke with him Christopher Tierney was still at the hospital.
Christopher Tierney, who appeared in the national tour of "Moving Out" and in "Dirty Dancing" in Toronto, is the show's main aerialist and performs stunts for the roles of Spider-Man and the villains Meeks and Kraven the Hunter. The cable to his harness apparently snapped, said a castmate who spoke on condition of anonymity because the performer was not authorized to speak publicly about the show.
"An accident like this is obviously heartbreaking for our entire team and, of course, to me personally," said Tony-winning director Julie Taymor in a statement. "I am so thankful that Chris is going to be all right and is in great spirits. Nothing is more important than the safety of our Spider-Man family and we'll continue to do everything in our power to protect the cast and crew."
The fall was the latest setback for the troubled $65 million show.
Conceived by Taymor and U2's Bono and The Edge, who wrote the music, "Spider-Man" has been more than eight years in the making. It has been plagued by delays, money woes and three other accidents, including one in which an actress suffered a concussion and another in which a performer broke his wrists in an aerial stunt. Its official opening has been postponed twice, to early February.
The huge costs - a 41-member cast, 18 orchestra members, complicated sets and 27 daring aerial stunts, including a battle between two characters over the audience - mean the 1,928-seat theater will have to virtually sell out every show for several years just to break even. The weekly running bill has been put as high as $1 million. (Tickets are $67.50 to $135 for weekday performances, $67.50 to $140 on weekends.)
One audience member who attended Monday's performance, Brian Lynch, said he knew of the previous mishaps and still wanted to come.
"I was making jokes about it earlier in the day," said Lynch, visiting from Hollywood, Calif. "I said if anyone got hurt I was ready to jump in and help out. I never thought it would happen, I thought they probably worked it all out. I really didn't think it would happen like it did. It was pretty horrific."
The accident happened during the show's big finale, when the Green Goblin drops Mary Jane and Spider-Man leaps to her rescue.
"But then he just kept falling, it seemed, and then everything went dark and then people, crew ran up to the stage and we heard the girl playing Mary Jane screaming from the pit," Lynch said.
It is not unusual for Broadway shows to experience mishaps and accidents during previews or out-of-town tryouts, where producers try to work out all problems before bringing a show to New York. Other Broadway shows have struggled with getting their sets and stunts to work during previews, including "Mary Poppins," whose house set went off track in 2006, and "Titanic," which was plagued by numerous technical problems during a month of previews in 1997. Both were hits.
And while "Spider-Man" has been unusually accident prone, many stage performers have suffered injuries over the years.
Legendary actress Sarah Bernhardt hurt her knee while jumping off a parapet in a performance in Rio de Janeiro in 1905. The leg never healed properly and was amputated 10 years later. Mary Martin, who was hoisted on a wire as Peter Pan in the 1950s, broke her elbow slamming into a concrete wall during a rehearsal.
More recently, Idina Menzel fractured a rib falling through a trap door in a 2005 performance of "Wicked" on Broadway. Also in 2005, Christina Applegate broke her foot during out-of-town previews for "Sweet Charity."
In February 2009, Kathleen Turner injured her knee while performing in an off-Broadway comedy called "The Third Story." She returned to the production with a leg brace and a cane.
Last week, the show's lead producer, Michael Cohl, delayed the official opening of "Spider-Man" for the second time, pushing it back from Jan. 11 to Feb. 7. He cited "some unforeseeable setbacks, most notably the injury of a principal cast member."
The first preview on Nov. 28 did not go well. The musical had to be halted five times because of technical glitches, and actress Natalie Mendoza, who plays Spider-Man's evil love interest Arachne, was hit in the head by a rope and suffered a concussion. She was sidelined for two weeks.

description.hltext_display: Comment on Chinese Passengers Beat Unruly Foreigner On Guangzhou Metro by Ho Hum
description.author: Ho Hum
description.content:
Ugh: haha ain’t that the truth.
I don’t have so much of a problem with what the onlookers did. If the guy was being an arsehole and roughly handling women, he probably deserved a good slap or two. The predictable fenqing kneejerk squawking about how laowai are king never disappoints, either.

description.hltext_display: La complicada vía de Pere Miró
description.content:
Olimpismo La posibilidad de que Pere Miró, de 54 años, actualmente residiendo en Lausana, sea el nuevo Secretari General de l'Esport de la Generalitat, es ahora mismo una vía muy difícil según se desprende de las manifestaciones que el propio interesado realizó ayer a Mundo Deportivo desde una estación de esquí suiza.
"Nadie me ha comunicado oficialmente nada. El viernes pasado estuve en Banyoles y gente del deporte me habló del tema, lo que me sorprendió mucho. La verdad es que es un rumor que me ha cogido en fuera de juego; repito que no hay nada de nada y ni me lo he planteado", afirmó Miró a este diario.
El actual director general de Solidaridad Olímpica reconoció, por otro lado, que "nunca me gusta cerrar puertas pero sería muy difícil que aceptara. Estoy muy apegado a Suiza, aunque me siento muy honrado de que hayan pensado en mí para dicho cargo, que sin duda es muy ilusionante, pero no sé de dónde ha podido salir esto".
El peso de Solidaridad
Miró, sin embargo, dijo estar muy satisfecho porque "después de dieciocho años viviendo fuera, que se acuerden de uno es un gran honor y todo un reconocimiento. El cargo de Secretari General de l'Esport es algo muy bonito si quieres a Catalunya como yo".
El que fuera subdirector de operaciones durante los Juegos Olímpicos de Barcelona'92 tiene intención de pasar esas fiestas navideñas en su Manresa natal. Quizá entonces se le haga una propuesta formal aunque Miró recalcó ayer a este diario que "sería una faena para Solidaridad Olímpica porque yo trabajo con planes cuatrienales y ahora estoy en medio de uno de ellos y no los puedo dejar colgados".
Gente que conoce bien a Miró y que trabajó con él en el COOB'92, manifestó a este diario que si aceptara el cargo de Secretari General de l'Esport "sería la mejor noticia para el deporte catalán porque es el hombre idóneo para el puesto y da el perfil perfecto". Pero también son realistas y saben que Miró "está encantado con su trabajo en Lausana y no lo dejará para volver a Catalunya".
El cargo de Secretari General de l'Esport dependerá directamente de Presidència, o sea, de Artur Mas, tal como se anunció en el acto de campaña con los deportistas de elite reunidos para presentar el programa de deportes de CiU.
Otro nombre que se unió a la terna de candidatos es el de Jordi Serra, actual secretario general de la Federación Internacional de Tenis de Mesa.

description.hltext_display: Суд сократил наказание обвиняемым в убийстве Сулима Ямадаева
description.content: Суд Дубая (Объединенные Арабские Эмираты) заменил пожизненное заключение на 27 месяцев тюрьмы двоим обвиняемым в убийстве Сулима Ямадаева, сообщает корреспондент РИА-Новости из зала суда. Обоснование решения суда будет оглашено через две недели. Покушение на бывшего командира чеченского батальона "Восток", Героя России Сулима Ямадаева было совершено в Дубае весной 2009 года. Год спустя дубайский суд приговорил иранца Махди Лорнию и гражданина Таджикистана Максуджона Исматова к ...

description.hltext_display: Un ministre britannique se fait piéger
description.author: Cyrille Vanlerberghe
description.content:
Pour avoir attaqué Murdoch devant de faux militants, le centriste Vince Cable met en porte à faux le gouvernement.«.» Avec ces quelques mots, le ministre du Commerce Vince Cable a plongé le gouvernement de coalition britannique dans un bel embarras. Le ministre libéral-démocrate, de facto numéro deux de Nick Clegg au sein de la coalition s'est fait piéger par deux journalistes du Daily Telegraph. Elles se sont fait passer pour des militantes libdems lors de la permanence qu'assure le député dans sa circonscription au sud-ouest de Londres.
Le dérapage de Vince Cable est d'autant plus grave que News Corporation, le groupe de Rupert Murdoch, s'efforce de racheter la totalité de l'opérateur de télévision par satellite BSkyB, une opération d'au moins 9 milliards d'euros qui ne peut se faire sans le feu vert du ministre du Commerce. Le très populaire Vince Cable a déjà compliqué la tentative de rachat de Sky par Murdoch en exigeant le mois dernier l'examen du dossier par l'autorité britannique de régulation des télécoms, en plus de l'autorisation demandée à Bruxelles en vertu des règles antimonopole. Il n'aura plus l'occasion de sévir, David Cameron vient de confier ce dossier au ministre de la Culture et des Médias.
Murdoch est un sujet très sensible au sein de la coalition. Lors de la dernière campagne électorale, David Cameron et les conservateurs avaient obtenu le soutien déclaré des grands titres du groupe News Corp., dont le Times et le Sun, alors que les libdems étaient régulièrement ridiculisés par les tabloïds du groupe.
Mardi, le Parti travailliste a demandé à ce que Vince Cable se retire immédiatement du processus de décision lié au rachat de BSkyB car son «impartialité était remise en cause». Des analystes faisaient remarquer mardi que les propos du ministre exposaient le gouvernement à une action en justice intentée par News Corporation en cas de décision défavorable.
Le premier article publié mardi matin par le Daily Telegraph sur les propos de Cable exposait au grand jour , mais ne mentionnait pas la sortie contre Murdoch. L'information n'a été révélée qu'en fin d'après-midi par la BBC, qui a reçu copie de l'enregistrement grâce à un contact au sein du journal.
Avec une grande franchise, Vince Cable expliquait que des désaccords très forts existaient au gouvernement sur des sujets aussi importants que la récente réforme des frais d'entrée à l'université, les quotas d'immigration ou encore le contrôle des bonus des banquiers. Pour tenter de convaincre ses interlocuteurs conservateurs, le dernier recours est «l'arme nucléaire», , a-t-il raconté aux deux journalistes travaillant sous-couvert. Lors de leur conférence de presse commune mardi au 10 Downing Street, le premier ministre, David Cameron, et le vice-premier ministre, Nick Clegg, ont fait front commun pour affirmer que la coalition est aussi solide que jamais. «Dans une coalition organisée par deux partis différents, il est normal qu'on ne soit pas d'accord sur tout, a expliqué Cameron. Si nous étions d'accord sur tout, nous serions dans le même parti ! Notre rôle est de discuter de ces sujets en privé pour arriver au meilleur accord possible pour le pays.» LIRE AUSSI :

description.hltext_display: China Health Resource Expands Partnership with Chengdu University for...
description.content:
CHRI and Chengdu can use their complementary resources and knowledge for the greater good by improving DAR quality and creating new DAR products, proven to be an integral part of Traditional Chinese Medicine.
China Health Resource Inc. is expanding its partnership with the prestigious Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine for research efforts to enhance Dahurian Angelica Root (DAR).
China Health Resource Inc. is a leader in the development, manufacturing, processing, marketing and sale of Dahurian Angelica Root (DAR) and related products in the People's Republic of China. CHRI is the only manufacturer of GAP certified DAR in China. DAR is an herb used as an ingredient in medicine, cosmetics and food. It also has become popular as a key component of Traditional Chinese Medicine for the treatment of pain, swelling and pustule.
Chengdu University, located in Chengdu, the capital city of Sichuan, is one of the oldest and most established Traditional Chinese Medicine educational institutions in China.
CHRI CEO Jiayin Wang said that the partnership with Chengdu University will lead to enhanced DAR quality and product expansion.
"CHRI and Chengdu can use their complementary resources and knowledge for the greater good by improving DAR quality and creating new DAR products, proven to be an integral part of Traditional Chinese Medicine," Mr. Wang said.
Esteemed Chengdu Professor Yuncheng Zheng is directly involved with the DAR research. He has more than three decades of experience in TCM drug testing and identification, drug application and development and technological advancements in researching TCM drugs.
"At Chengdu, we have the most advanced research capabilities that, integrated with CHRI's technology, can lead to the best quality and products that will further enhance DAR's role in TCM,” said Professor Zheng.
About CHRI
China Health Resource Inc. engages in the development, manufacturing, processing, marketing and sale of Dahurian Angelica Root (DAR) and related products in the People's Republic of China. DAR, which is also known as “Bai Zhi” in Mandarin Chinese, is an herb that is employed as an ingredient in medicine, cosmetics and food, as well as used in TCM for the treatment of pain, swelling and pustule. The company's DAR-related products include the Bailing Capsule, Yisheng Capsule, Kimchee-Mate and Fragrant Bag, all of which are sold through regional distributors. The company was founded in 2001 and is based in Suining.
About Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine is one of the first educational institutions to focus completely on Traditional Chinese Medicine. The university awards Chinese medicine doctorates, master’s degrees and offers post-doctoral research opportunities with the Ministry of Health and Ministry of Education.

description.hltext_display: Spider-Man in de lappenmand
description.content: De Broadway-musical "Spider-Man Turn Off the Dark" wordt geplaagd door ongelukken. Tijdens een try-out in New York is een stuntman in het ziekenhuis beland. De show werd zeven minuten voor het eind stilgelegd, zo schrijft The New York Times. De stuntman vloog als Spider-Man door de lucht toen zijn draad knapte. Hij zou enkele gebroken ribben hebben opgelopen. De producer heeft daarop extra veiligheidsmaatregelen aangekondigd, maar gaf geen details. De officiële première, die overigens al meermaals werd uitgesteld, is nu gepland voor 7 februari. De musical over de superheld is de duurste Broadway-productie ooit met een kostenplaatje van omgerekend 50 miljoen euro. De liedjes zijn geschreven door Bono en The Edge van de Ierse rockband U2.

description.hltext_display: - DES RELIGIONS (OU CROYANCES) NE SONT-ELLES PAS UN FREIN AU PROGRES ?
description.content:
1) Sans analyser en détail sur un plan historique ou géographique, ne peut-on considérer que des religions (ou croyances de toutes sortes) ont tendance à freiner le développement économique et scientifique, notamment, de pays en voie de développement, indépendamment des conditions historiques (colonisation,...), climatiques ou de niveau scolaire ?
2) - Qu'il s'agisse des contraintes de tous ordres (prières quotidiennes, jeunes, pèlerinages, vestimentaires, interdits gastronomiques, de prêts à intérêts sauf pour le protestantisme,...), les religions (ou croyances de toutes sortes) ne constituent-elles pas un carcan ?
3) Indépendamment d'autres causes qui alourdiraient le propos, on constatera le développement de pays moins religieux, par exemple :
- la Chine où s'est produit un essor commercial indéniable (avec des conséquences sociales insupportables pour la population) malgré une démographie importante, pays considéré, il y a moins de 20 ans, comme un handicap insurmontable,
- l'Inde qui connaît un développement scientifique et technique remarquable,
par rapport aux retards enregistrés, notamment dans certains pays d'Afrique.
Alerter
religion, Asie , Afrique , Chine , pesanteur , progrès , retard , Economie

description.hltext_display: Events around Whitefish River election nominations don't add up
description.content:
Residents have taken action to help deer population
To the Expositor:
Regarding the December 8 letter "Visiting hunters dismayed by lack of deer on Island's West End," Mr. Kirkey should visit our beautiful Island during the off-hunting seasons—drive through the country and see huge herds of beautiful deer (does and fawns).
He feels "something must be done." Well, I want him to know that many residents of Manitoulin have done something—they now set up feeding stations for the deer and are able to watch these gorgeous animals visit close to their homes.
They are smart animals and stay on private property (no hunting) where they can find food and don't stray until the hunters have gone.
We won't miss the hunters, but sure would miss the deer.
M. Gordon
Barrie
Donation boxes create awkward position for shoppers
To the Expositor:
I wanted to applaud Charlie Pratt for being brave enough to state something, a few weeks back ("Shopper tired of retail donation boxes," November 10), that many of us have been thinking and feeling but not willing to speak up about; that being the situation where customers are asked if they want to contribute financially to some cause or other while in line at a cashier.
Whether a person contributes to any cause is a personal choice and not the business of the cashier or the other shoppers within earshot. It puts a person in an awkward position and frankly deters me from frequenting that business. Perhaps slipping a piece of paper or envelope into the shopping bag with the pertinent information on it would make it a friendlier way of reaching the same goal.
Best wishes to all.
Gail Robinson
Little Current
Upper lakes study only taking cursory look at raising levels
To the Expositor:
Regarding the December 1 article, "Canada, US to look at plans to raise level of Lake Huron," I wish to advise that your article may create a false sense of security to your readers.
It was with some degree of surprise that I recently learned that the well-known Georgian Bay advocate Mary Muter was dismissed from the board of Georgian Bay Forever, while the CEO of Canada Steamship Lines is among several new appointees. Mary has devoted 20 years of exceptional work on the science and politics of water quality and quantity of the Great Lakes to environmental organizations. I feel that under the circumstances, one must question the objectivity of her replacement, a person who has strong ties to the shipping industry. Thankfully, Ms. Muter is now head of the Great Lakes section of the Sierra Club, Ontario, where hopefully her talents and knowledge will be more fully appreciated.
Mr. Sweetnam, as quoted in your December 1 article, seems to be overly optimistic in his view that lake levels will be restored to those enjoyed prior to the past decade. Since 1998 they have been consistently hovering around chart datum, as those of us who live on the Manitoulin shore know only too well.
Mr. Sweetnam fails to mention that the International Joint Commission (IJC) study is also looking at "doing nothing" again, for the commissioners' direction to the study is to look at raising Lakes Michigan-Huron-Georgian Bay levels by zero, as well as by 10, 25, 40, or 50 centimetres. The IJC's study board is taking only a cursory look at if and how that might be done. Its researchers are in fact not examining the benefits to marinas, landowners or the ecosystem. Raising levels by 50 centimetres without placing flexible controls at the outflow (the St. Clair River) could in fact result in levels above the 1986 high. Not raising those levels at all could, if the current downward trend continues, soon take them to the disastrous 1964 low. We need flexible controls at the St. Clair River that can be used when and if appropriate in order to return these lakes to closer to average levels. There is currently no direction from the IJC on this need of flexibility.
What this article does not tell us, but what informed observers believe, is that the Upper Great Lakes Study Board is trying to pay lip service to the new directions given by the IJC commissioners while coming up with the real possibility of yet another "millions-of-dollars-do-nothing" report. Perhaps the optimism expressed by David Sweetnam is naïve at best.
Manitoulin Island is into its 12th year of sustained low water levels. Our newly exposed shorelines provide the perfect opportunity for the invasive reed phragmites australis, brought to Lake Huron via ballast dumping by foreign ships, to take over. This reed grows as high as 15 feet and takes over exposed shoreline habitats to the exclusion of native fish and wildlife species.
As human population and industrialization continue to increase in the Great Lakes basin, it is becoming increasingly obvious that problems with Lake Huron levels will continue to dog us unless we citizens act aggressively. They are messing with our lake!
I suggest that we host the new Sierra Club Great Lakes section at an open forum to take place here on the Manitoulin this winter—perhaps in March, not during the school break. A central location such as the Mindemoya Community Centre would serve well.
I sincerely hope that between us we can foster sufficient interest among Manitouliners that we may be able to stimulate action in other communities along the Lake Huron shore.
Mike Wilton
Dominion Bay
Central dog pound unfit for animal habitation
To the Expositor:
I am writing in regards to the municipal township yard dog pound in Mindemoya, which is for Central Manitoulin, located behind the roads/highway building. It is a four-sided cinderblock building with two stalls that are also cement, including the floor. The doors on either side, with a small screened window on each side, lets in little air. The dogs that are unfortunate enough to end up there get to sit or stand only with no outdoor run. In the summer it is extremely hot and this winter it will be extremely cold for them.
Now, I know a lot of people think, "They are just dogs—so what?" Well, my opinion is that they feel hot and cold just like me, and I am thoroughly disgusted to think of any animal having to put up with these conditions. The person in control of the pound is charging $200 and above for you to get your pet out, so where is that money going? I know they got a large amount of money this summer from the dogs they picked up, so why isn't any of it being used for the care of these animals? I have animals and know how much it costs to feed a dog, and I don't believe the person responsible is buying premium dog food.
Hopefully with new people having been voted into this township something may be done about these antiquated conditions.
Barbara Taylor Black
Spring Bay
To the Expositor:
In regards to the December 8 articles, "Ballot snafu delays polls in Birch Isl." and "Indian Affairs seeks wisdom in Whitefish River First Nation," I share the following information and comments.
The nominations for the Whitefish River First Nation chief and council were slated for November 27, yet the community members did not receive official notice of the cancellation of the nomination meeting until November 29. In this letter to the community the membership was informed that Indian and Northern Affairs was to have sent mail-out nomination forms to all registered electoral officers in February of 2010. I would say that this time period affords the electoral officer over eight months to ensure that the election process is sound; the fact (?) that the electoral officer did not receive the package at this time should most certainly have called the credibility of the process into question, at the very least, months before the mail-out of nomination forms, and not days—as it would appear to be, given the delayed notice to the Whitefish River First Nation membership.
Another interesting note is that the community was informed that, "The requirements under the Indian Act state that the elections must occur at least 30 days from the mail-out of nomination forms. The nomination forms are being mailed out November 30, 2010. The elections for the Whitefish River First Nation chief and council will be held February 12, 2011."
Somehow things just don't add up, but I guess you can't believe everything you read. Indian Affairs may seek wisdom in Whitefish River First Nation, but as the saying goes, "the wisdom of man is foolishness in the eyes of God," and the regularity of our botched elections is proof of that. One could even call it irregularity—at least there's entertainment value in that. Thanks for the articles.
